question.title: Will the United States Democratic Party propose new nuclear safety regulations before January 1, 2028?
question.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if the United States Democratic Party officially proposes new nuclear safety regulations between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The proposal must be documented in an official statement or legislative bill introduced by the party.

not_P.title: Will the United States Democratic Party not propose new nuclear safety regulations before January 1, 2028?
not_P.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if the United States Democratic Party does not officially propose new nuclear safety regulations between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The absence of a proposal must be documented in an official statement or legislative bill introduced by the party.

para_P.title: Is it expected that the Democratic Party of the United States will introduce new regulations for nuclear safety prior to January 1, 2028?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered 'Yes' if the Democratic Party of the United States formally puts forward new nuclear safety regulations from October 1, 2024, through January 1, 2028. The introduction must be recorded in an official announcement or a legislative bill presented by the party.

question.title: Given the United States Democratic Party proposes new nuclear safety regulations, will Taiwan implement a nationwide ban on single-use plastics before January 1, 2028?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: The United States Democratic Party officially proposes new nuclear safety regulations between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The proposal must be documented in an official statement or legislative bill introduced by the party. Then, will Taiwan implement a nationwide ban on single-use plastics before January 1, 2028? This question resolves as 'Yes' if, between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, Taiwan implements a nationwide ban on single-use plastics. The ban must be officially enacted and published in Taiwan's official legal records and must cover the entire nation.

not_P.title: Given the United States Democratic Party proposes new nuclear safety regulations, will Taiwan not implement a nationwide ban on single-use plastics before January 1, 2028?
not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: The United States Democratic Party officially proposes new nuclear safety regulations between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The proposal must be documented in an official statement or legislative bill introduced by the party. Then, will Taiwan not implement a nationwide ban on single-use plastics before January 1, 2028? This question resolves as 'Yes' if, between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, Taiwan does not implement a nationwide ban on single-use plastics. The ban must not be officially enacted and published in Taiwan's official legal records and must not cover the entire nation.

para_P.title: If the Democratic Party of the United States introduces new regulations for nuclear safety, will Taiwan enforce a complete prohibition on single-use plastics prior to January 1, 2028?
para_P.body: Assume the following holds true: The Democratic Party of the United States formally introduces new nuclear safety regulations sometime between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. This proposal needs to be recorded in an official statement or a legislative bill presented by the party. Then, will Taiwan enforce a complete prohibition on single-use plastics before January 1, 2028? This question will be answered with 'Yes' if, during the period from October 1, 2024, to January 1, 2028, Taiwan enacts a nationwide prohibition on single-use plastics. The prohibition must be officially established and recorded in Taiwan's official legal documentation and must apply to the entire country.

question.title: Given that both the US Democratic Party proposes new nuclear safety regulations and Taiwan implements a nationwide ban on single-use plastics before January 1, 2028, will an AI system be used to develop a new environmental policy in the UK before January 1, 2028?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both (a) the United States Democratic Party officially proposes new nuclear safety regulations, documented in an official statement or legislative bill introduced by the party, and (b) Taiwan implements a nationwide ban on single-use plastics, officially enacted and published in Taiwan's official legal records covering the entire nation, occur between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. 

Then, will an AI system be used to develop a new environmental policy in the United Kingdom before January 1, 2028? This will be resolved as 'Yes' if, between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, an AI system is officially used to develop a new environmental policy in the United Kingdom, with the policy being formally adopted by the UK government and publicly documented as being developed with the assistance of an AI system.

not_P.title: Given that it is not the case that both the US Democratic Party proposes new nuclear safety regulations and Taiwan implements a nationwide ban on single-use plastics before January 1, 2028, will an AI system not be used to develop a new environmental policy in the UK before January 1, 2028?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Either (a) the United States Democratic Party does not officially propose new nuclear safety regulations, documented in an official statement or legislative bill introduced by the party, or (b) Taiwan does not implement a nationwide ban on single-use plastics, officially enacted and published in Taiwan's official legal records covering the entire nation, occurs between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. 

Then, will an AI system not be used to develop a new environmental policy in the United Kingdom before January 1, 2028? This will be resolved as 'Yes' if, between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, an AI system is not officially used to develop a new environmental policy in the United Kingdom, with the policy not being formally adopted by the UK government and not publicly documented as being developed with the assistance of an AI system.

para_P.title: If the US Democratic Party introduces fresh nuclear safety regulations and Taiwan enacts a comprehensive ban on single-use plastics prior to January 1, 2028, will the UK utilize an AI system to formulate a new environmental policy before that date?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: (a) the United States Democratic Party formally introduces new nuclear safety regulations, as evidenced by an official statement or a legislative bill presented by the party, and (b) Taiwan enacts a comprehensive ban on single-use plastics, officially recorded and published in the nation's legal documents, both occurring between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. 

Consequently, will the UK employ an AI system to create a new environmental policy before January 1, 2028? This will be answered with a 'Yes' if, within the timeframe of October 1, 2024, to January 1, 2028, an AI system is officially utilized to establish a new environmental policy in the UK, which is then formally accepted by the UK government and publicly acknowledged as developed with the aid of an AI system.

question.title: Given FDA approval of a new treatment for radiation sickness, will AI be used to edit human genes clinically by 2028?
question.body:

(2) OpenAI introduces an AI system that can pass the US bar exam anytime from October 1, 2024, to January 1, 2028, with the AI achieving a passing score as determined by the National Conference of Bar Examiners (NCBE), and this success being verified by credible sources. (3) A national government publicly declares the establishment of an artificial intelligence policy created in collaboration with OpenAI between the time this question was formulated and January 1, 2028. The declaration must be issued through official government channels and explicitly reference OpenAI's participation.

question.title: Will a film produced in Taiwan win the Academy Award for Best International Feature Film before January 1, 2028?
question.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if a film primarily produced in Taiwan wins the Academy Award for Best International Feature Film at any Academy Awards ceremony held between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The win must be officially announced by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences.

not_P.title: Will a film produced in Taiwan not win the Academy Award for Best International Feature Film before January 1, 2028?
not_P.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if no film primarily produced in Taiwan wins the Academy Award for Best International Feature Film at any Academy Awards ceremony held between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The win must be officially announced by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences.

para_P.title: Is it possible for a movie made in Taiwan to secure the Academy Award for Best International Feature Film prior to January 1, 2028?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with 'Yes' if a movie predominantly produced in Taiwan is awarded the Academy Award for Best International Feature Film during any Academy Awards event occurring between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The victory must be formally declared by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences.

question.title: If a film produced in Taiwan wins the Academy Award for Best International Feature Film before January 1, 2028, will the United States hold a presidential election resulting in a new president before January 1, 2028?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: A film primarily produced in Taiwan wins the Academy Award for Best International Feature Film at any Academy Awards ceremony held between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The win must be officially announced by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences. Then, will the United States hold a presidential election resulting in a new president before January 1, 2028? The question will resolve as 'Yes' if, within this timeframe, the United States holds a presidential election that results in the election of a new president, who must be officially confirmed by the relevant U.S. election authorities and reported by major news outlets. If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

not_P.title: If a film produced in Taiwan wins the Academy Award for Best International Feature Film before January 1, 2028, will the United States not hold a presidential election resulting in a new president before January 1, 2028?
not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: A film primarily produced in Taiwan wins the Academy Award for Best International Feature Film at any Academy Awards ceremony held between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The win must be officially announced by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences. Then, will the United States not hold a presidential election resulting in a new president before January 1, 2028? The question will resolve as 'Yes' if, within this timeframe, the United States does not hold a presidential election that results in the election of a new president, who must be officially confirmed by the relevant U.S. election authorities and reported by major news outlets. If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: Should a film from Taiwan secure the Academy Award for Best International Feature Film prior to January 1, 2028, will there be a presidential election in the United States that leads to the selection of a new president before January 1, 2028?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds true: A film that is predominantly produced in Taiwan receives the Academy Award for Best International Feature Film during any Academy Awards event that takes place between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The victory must be officially declared by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences. Then, will the United States conduct a presidential election that results in the appointment of a new president prior to January 1, 2028? This inquiry will be considered 'Yes' if, within this specified period, a presidential election occurs in the United States that culminates in the election of a new president, who must be officially recognized by the appropriate U.S. election authorities and reported by major news media. If this condition is not satisfied, the inquiry will be resolved as N/A.

question.title: If both a Taiwanese film wins Best International Feature Film and the US elects a new president before 2028, will Brazil reduce Amazon deforestation by 70%?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both of the following occur before January 1, 2028: (a) A film primarily produced in Taiwan wins the Academy Award for Best International Feature Film, with the win officially announced by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences; and (b) The United States holds a presidential election resulting in a new president, with the new president officially confirmed by the relevant U.S. election authorities and reported by major news outlets.

Then, will Brazil reduce deforestation in the Amazon by at least 70% compared to 2020 levels before January 1, 2028? The deforestation data must be verified by Brazil's National Institute for Space Research (INPE) or another reputable environmental monitoring organization.

not_P.title: If both a Taiwanese film does not win Best International Feature Film or the US does not elect a new president before 2028, will Brazil not reduce Amazon deforestation by 70%?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: At least one of the following does not occur before January 1, 2028: (a) A film primarily produced in Taiwan wins the Academy Award for Best International Feature Film, with the win officially announced by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences; or (b) The United States holds a presidential election resulting in a new president, with the new president officially confirmed by the relevant U.S. election authorities and reported by major news outlets.

Then, will Brazil not reduce deforestation in the Amazon by at least 70% compared to 2020 levels before January 1, 2028? The deforestation data must be verified by Brazil's National Institute for Space Research (INPE) or another reputable environmental monitoring organization.

para_P.title: Should both a Taiwanese movie secure the Academy Award for Best International Feature Film and the United States appoint a new president prior to 2028, will Brazil achieve a 70% reduction in Amazon deforestation?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Both of these events take place before January 1, 2028: (a) A film mainly produced in Taiwan is awarded the Oscar for Best International Feature Film, with the announcement made by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences; and (b) The United States conducts a presidential election that results in a new president, who is officially recognized by the appropriate U.S. election authorities and covered by major news organizations.

Then, will Brazil manage to decrease deforestation in the Amazon by at least 70% in comparison to the levels recorded in 2020 before January 1, 2028? The deforestation statistics must be validated by Brazil's National Institute for Space Research (INPE) or another credible environmental monitoring agency.

question.title: Will all of the following occur before January 1, 2028: (a) A film produced in Taiwan wins the Academy Award for Best International Feature Film, (b) The United States holds a presidential election resulting in a new president, and (c) Brazil reduces deforestation in the Amazon by at least 70% compared to 2020 levels?
question.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if all of the following conditions are met before January 1, 2028: (a) A film primarily produced in Taiwan wins the Academy Award for Best International Feature Film at any Academy Awards ceremony held between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, with the win officially announced by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences; (b) The United States holds a presidential election between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, resulting in the election of a new president, with the new president officially confirmed by the relevant U.S. election authorities and reported by major news outlets; and (c) Brazil reduces deforestation in the Amazon by at least 70% compared to 2020 levels before January 1, 2028, with the deforestation data verified by Brazil's National Institute for Space Research (INPE) or another reputable environmental monitoring organization.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur before January 1, 2028: (a) A film produced in Taiwan wins the Academy Award for Best International Feature Film, (b) The United States holds a presidential election resulting in a new president, and (c) Brazil reduces deforestation in the Amazon by at least 70% compared to 2020 levels?
not_P.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if at least one of the following conditions is not met before January 1, 2028: (a) A film primarily produced in Taiwan does not win the Academy Award for Best International Feature Film at any Academy Awards ceremony held between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, with the win officially announced by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences; (b) The United States does not hold a presidential election between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, resulting in the election of a new president, with the new president officially confirmed by the relevant U.S. election authorities and reported by major news outlets; or (c) Brazil does not reduce deforestation in the Amazon by at least 70% compared to 2020 levels before January 1, 2028, with the deforestation data verified by Brazil's National Institute for Space Research (INPE) or another reputable environmental monitoring organization.

para_P.title: Will all of the following happen prior to January 1, 2028: (a) An internationally recognized film from Taiwan receives the Academy Award for Best International Feature Film, (b) A presidential election takes place in the United States resulting in a new leader, and (c) Brazil achieves a reduction in Amazon deforestation by at least 70% relative to the levels of 2020?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with 'Yes' if the following criteria are fulfilled before January 1, 2028: (a) A film largely produced in Taiwan wins the Academy Award for Best International Feature Film at any Academy Awards event occurring between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, with the victory officially declared by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences; (b) A presidential election is conducted in the United States between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, leading to the election of a new leader, with the new leader officially recognized by the appropriate U.S. election authorities and covered by major news organizations; and (c) Brazil attains a reduction in Amazon deforestation by at least 70% compared to the figures from 2020 before January 1, 2028, with the deforestation statistics validated by Brazil's National Institute for Space Research (INPE) or another credible environmental monitoring agency.

question.title: Will a NATO member country invoke Article 5 before January 1, 2028?
question.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if any NATO member country invokes Article 5 between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The invocation must be officially confirmed by NATO's official records and public statements.

not_P.title: Will no NATO member country invoke Article 5 before January 1, 2028?
not_P.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if no NATO member country invokes Article 5 between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The invocation must be officially confirmed by NATO's official records and public statements.

para_P.title: Will any nation that is part of NATO activate Article 5 prior to the first day of 2028?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with 'Yes' if any nation that is a member of NATO activates Article 5 during the period from October 1, 2024, to January 1, 2028. The activation must be officially acknowledged through NATO's official documentation and public announcements.

question.title: Conditional on a NATO member country invoking Article 5 before January 1, 2028, will Brazil's GDP growth rate exceed 3% for any calendar year between 2025 and 2027?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: A NATO member country invokes Article 5 between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, as officially confirmed by NATO's official records and public statements. Then, will Brazil's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) growth rate, as reported by the Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics (IBGE), exceed 3% for any calendar year between January 1, 2025, and December 31, 2027? The growth rate must be based on IBGE's official annual GDP data.

not_P.title: Conditional on a NATO member country invoking Article 5 before January 1, 2028, will Brazil's GDP growth rate not exceed 3% for any calendar year between 2025 and 2027?
not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: A NATO member country invokes Article 5 between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, as officially confirmed by NATO's official records and public statements. Then, will Brazil's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) growth rate, as reported by the Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics (IBGE), not exceed 3% for any calendar year between January 1, 2025, and December 31, 2027? The growth rate must be based on IBGE's official annual GDP data.

para_P.title: If a NATO member nation activates Article 5 prior to January 1, 2028, will Brazil's GDP growth rate surpass 3% during any year from 2025 to 2027?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds true: A NATO member nation activates Article 5 at some point between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, as officially documented by NATO's records and public declarations. Will Brazil's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) growth rate, as stated by the Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics (IBGE), exceed 3% in any calendar year from January 1, 2025, to December 31, 2027? The growth rate must rely on the official annual GDP figures provided by IBGE.

question.title: Given both a NATO member invokes Article 5 and Brazil's GDP growth exceeds 3% in a year, will China achieve net positive energy from nuclear fusion by 2028?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both of the following occur: (a) A NATO member country invokes Article 5 before January 1, 2028, and (b) Brazil's GDP growth rate exceeds 3% for any calendar year between 2025 and 2027. This means: 

(a) Any NATO member country invokes Article 5 between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The invocation must be officially confirmed by NATO's official records and public statements.

(b) Brazil's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) growth rate, as reported by the Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics (IBGE), exceeds 3% for any calendar year between January 1, 2025, and December 31, 2027. The growth rate must be based on IBGE's official annual GDP data.

Then, is the following true? China achieves net positive energy output from a nuclear fusion reactor before January 1, 2028. This requires that, between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, a nuclear fusion reactor in China achieves net positive energy output, meaning the reactor produces more energy than it consumes. The achievement must be verified by a reputable scientific organization or governmental body.

not_P.title: Given both a NATO member does not invoke Article 5 and Brazil's GDP growth does not exceed 3% in a year, will China not achieve net positive energy from nuclear fusion by 2028?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both of the following do not occur: (a) No NATO member country invokes Article 5 before January 1, 2028, and (b) Brazil's GDP growth rate does not exceed 3% for any calendar year between 2025 and 2027. This means: 

(a) No NATO member country invokes Article 5 between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The invocation must be officially confirmed by NATO's official records and public statements.

(b) Brazil's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) growth rate, as reported by the Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics (IBGE), does not exceed 3% for any calendar year between January 1, 2025, and December 31, 2027. The growth rate must be based on IBGE's official annual GDP data.

Then, is the following true? China does not achieve net positive energy output from a nuclear fusion reactor before January 1, 2028. This requires that, between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, a nuclear fusion reactor in China does not achieve net positive energy output, meaning the reactor does not produce more energy than it consumes. The achievement must be verified by a reputable scientific organization or governmental body.

para_P.title: If a NATO country activates Article 5 and Brazil's GDP growth is above 3% in a given year, will China secure net positive energy from nuclear fusion by the year 2028?
para_P.body:
Assume the following conditions are satisfied: Both of the subsequent events take place: (a) A NATO member state activates Article 5 prior to January 1, 2028, and (b) Brazil's GDP growth rate surpasses 3% for any calendar year from 2025 to 2027. This indicates: 

(a) Any NATO member state activates Article 5 during the period from October 1, 2024, to January 1, 2028. The activation must be officially documented by NATO's records and public announcements.

(b) The growth rate of Brazil's Gross Domestic Product (GDP), as published by the Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics (IBGE), exceeds 3% for any calendar year between January 1, 2025, and December 31, 2027. The growth rate must be derived from IBGE's official annual GDP statistics.

Then, is the following statement correct? China attains net positive energy production from a nuclear fusion reactor before January 1, 2028. This necessitates that, within the timeframe of October 1, 2024, to January 1, 2028, a nuclear fusion reactor in China produces more energy than it consumes, and this accomplishment must be validated by a credible scientific organization or governmental authority.

question.title: Will all of the following occur before January 1, 2028: (a) A NATO member country invokes Article 5, (b) Brazil's GDP growth rate exceeds 3% for any calendar year between 2025 and 2027, and (c) China achieves net positive energy output from a nuclear fusion reactor?
question.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if all of the following conditions are met: (a) Any NATO member country invokes Article 5 between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The invocation must be officially confirmed by NATO's official records and public statements. (b) Brazil's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) growth rate, as reported by the Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics (IBGE), exceeds 3% for any calendar year between January 1, 2025, and December 31, 2027. The growth rate must be based on IBGE's official annual GDP data. (c) Between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, a nuclear fusion reactor in China achieves net positive energy output, meaning the reactor produces more energy than it consumes. The achievement must be verified by a reputable scientific organization or governmental body.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur before January 1, 2028: (a) A NATO member country does not invoke Article 5, (b) Brazil's GDP growth rate does not exceed 3% for any calendar year between 2025 and 2027, or (c) China does not achieve net positive energy output from a nuclear fusion reactor?
not_P.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if not all of the following conditions are met: (a) No NATO member country invokes Article 5 between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The invocation must be officially confirmed by NATO's official records and public statements. (b) Brazil's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) growth rate, as reported by the Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics (IBGE), does not exceed 3% for any calendar year between January 1, 2025, and December 31, 2027. The growth rate must be based on IBGE's official annual GDP data. (c) Between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, a nuclear fusion reactor in China does not achieve net positive energy output, meaning the reactor produces less energy than it consumes. The achievement must be verified by a reputable scientific organization or governmental body.

para_P.title: Will the following events take place prior to January 1, 2028: (a) An invocation of Article 5 by a NATO member nation, (b) Brazil's GDP growth rate surpassing 3% in any year from 2025 to 2027, and (c) China realizing a net positive energy output from a nuclear fusion reactor?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with 'Yes' if all these criteria are fulfilled: (a) At least one NATO member nation invokes Article 5 between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, with the invocation being officially documented in NATO's records and public communications. (b) Brazil's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) growth rate, as reported by the Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics (IBGE), exceeds 3% in any calendar year from January 1, 2025, to December 31, 2027, based on IBGE's official annual GDP statistics. (c) Between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, a nuclear fusion reactor in China achieves a net positive energy output, indicating that the reactor generates more energy than it consumes, with this accomplishment being validated by a credible scientific institution or government agency.

question.title: Will a member country of NATO hold a national referendum on NATO membership before January 1, 2028?
question.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if a member country of NATO holds a national referendum specifically on the issue of NATO membership between the creation date of this question and January 1, 2028. The referendum must be officially recorded and the results certified by the relevant national election authorities.

not_P.title: Will a member country of NATO not hold a national referendum on NATO membership before January 1, 2028?
not_P.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if a member country of NATO does not hold a national referendum specifically on the issue of NATO membership between the creation date of this question and January 1, 2028. The referendum must be officially recorded and the results certified by the relevant national election authorities.

para_P.title: Is it possible for a NATO member state to conduct a national vote regarding its NATO membership prior to January 1, 2028?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with 'Yes' if a NATO member state organizes a national vote focused on the topic of NATO membership from the time this question is posed until January 1, 2028. The vote must be officially documented and the outcomes verified by the appropriate national electoral authorities.

question.title: Conditional on a NATO member holding a referendum on NATO membership, will a new chemical process reducing greenhouse gas emissions by 30% be implemented before 2028?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: A member country of NATO holds a national referendum on NATO membership between now and January 1, 2028. The referendum must be officially recorded and the results certified by the relevant national election authorities.

Then, is the following also true? A new chemical process that reduces greenhouse gas emissions by at least 30% compared to existing processes is commercially implemented between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The implementation must be documented in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or confirmed by an authorized governmental body.

Resolution criteria: If the condition regarding the NATO referendum is met, the question resolves based on the implementation of the chemical process. If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

not_P.title: Conditional on a NATO member holding a referendum on NATO membership, will a new chemical process reducing greenhouse gas emissions by less than 30% be implemented before 2028?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: A member country of NATO holds a national referendum on NATO membership between now and January 1, 2028. The referendum must be officially recorded and the results certified by the relevant national election authorities.

Then, is the following also true? A new chemical process that reduces greenhouse gas emissions by less than 30% compared to existing processes is commercially implemented between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The implementation must be documented in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or confirmed by an authorized governmental body.

Resolution criteria: If the condition regarding the NATO referendum is met, the question resolves based on the implementation of the chemical process. If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: If a NATO member conducts a referendum on its NATO membership, will a novel chemical method that decreases greenhouse gas emissions by 30% be put into practice prior to 2028?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: A NATO member state carries out a national referendum concerning its NATO membership before January 1, 2028. The referendum results must be officially recorded and certified by the appropriate national election authorities.

Is it also accurate to say this? A new chemical method that lowers greenhouse gas emissions by at least 30% in comparison to current methods is put into commercial use between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The implementation should be documented in a peer-reviewed scientific publication or verified by an authorized governmental agency.

Resolution criteria: If the condition regarding the NATO referendum is satisfied, the question will be resolved based on the implementation of the chemical method. If the condition is not satisfied, the question will be resolved as N/A.

question.title: Given NATO referendum and greenhouse gas reduction, will China announce commercial nuclear fusion before 2028?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before January 1, 2028, (a) a member country of NATO holds a national referendum on NATO membership, and (b) a new chemical process that reduces greenhouse gas emissions by at least 30% is commercially implemented. Then, will China announce the development of a commercial nuclear fusion reactor before January 1, 2028?

Resolution Criteria:
- For the condition: (a) The NATO referendum must be officially recorded and results certified by the national election authorities. (b) The new chemical process must be documented in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or confirmed by an authorized governmental body.
- For the outcome: The Chinese government or a Chinese energy company must publicly announce the development of a commercial nuclear fusion reactor, with the announcement reported by major news outlets and confirmed by official Chinese sources, between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028.

not_P.title: Given NATO referendum and greenhouse gas reduction, will China not announce commercial nuclear fusion before 2028?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before January 1, 2028, (a) a member country of NATO holds a national referendum on NATO membership, and (b) a new chemical process that reduces greenhouse gas emissions by at least 30% is commercially implemented. Then, will China not announce the development of a commercial nuclear fusion reactor before January 1, 2028?

Resolution Criteria:
- For the condition: (a) The NATO referendum must be officially recorded and results certified by the national election authorities. (b) The new chemical process must be documented in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or confirmed by an authorized governmental body.
- For the outcome: The Chinese government or a Chinese energy company must not publicly announce the development of a commercial nuclear fusion reactor, with the announcement not reported by major news outlets and not confirmed by official Chinese sources, between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028.

para_P.title: Will China declare the launch of commercial nuclear fusion prior to 2028, considering the NATO referendum and greenhouse gas reduction?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Before the date of January 1, 2028, (a) a NATO member nation conducts a national vote regarding its NATO membership, and (b) a novel chemical method that decreases greenhouse gas emissions by a minimum of 30% is put into commercial use. Then, will China make a public announcement regarding the establishment of a commercial nuclear fusion reactor before January 1, 2028?

Resolution Criteria:
- For the condition: (a) The NATO vote must be officially documented and the results verified by the national election authorities. (b) The new chemical method must be published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or validated by an authorized governmental entity.
- For the outcome: The Chinese government or a Chinese energy firm must make a public declaration about the development of a commercial nuclear fusion reactor, with the announcement covered by major news organizations and verified by official Chinese sources, between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028.

question.title: Will all of the following occur before January 1, 2028: (a) A member country of NATO holds a national referendum on NATO membership, (b) A new chemical process that reduces greenhouse gas emissions by at least 30% is commercially implemented, and (c) China announces the development of a commercial nuclear fusion reactor?
question.body:
(a) A member country of NATO must hold a national referendum specifically on the issue of NATO membership between the creation date of this question and January 1, 2028. The referendum must be officially recorded and the results certified by the relevant national election authorities.

(b) A new chemical process that reduces greenhouse gas emissions by at least 30% compared to existing processes must be commercially implemented between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The implementation must be documented in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or confirmed by an authorized governmental body.

(c) The Chinese government or a Chinese energy company must publicly announce the development of a commercial nuclear fusion reactor between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The announcement must be reported by major news outlets and confirmed by official Chinese sources.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur before January 1, 2028: (a) A member country of NATO holds a national referendum on NATO membership, (b) A new chemical process that reduces greenhouse gas emissions by at least 30% is commercially implemented, and (c) China announces the development of a commercial nuclear fusion reactor?
not_P.body:
(a) A member country of NATO must not hold a national referendum specifically on the issue of NATO membership between the creation date of this question and January 1, 2028. The referendum must not be officially recorded and the results certified by the relevant national election authorities.

(b) A new chemical process that reduces greenhouse gas emissions by at least 30% compared to existing processes must not be commercially implemented between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The implementation must not be documented in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or confirmed by an authorized governmental body.

(c) The Chinese government or a Chinese energy company must not publicly announce the development of a commercial nuclear fusion reactor between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The announcement must not be reported by major news outlets and confirmed by official Chinese sources.

para_P.title: Will the following events take place prior to January 1, 2028: (a) A NATO member state conducts a national vote regarding its NATO membership, (b) A novel chemical method that decreases greenhouse gas emissions by at least 30% is put into commercial use, and (c) China reveals plans for a commercial nuclear fusion reactor?
para_P.body:
(a) A NATO member state is required to carry out a national vote specifically addressing the matter of NATO membership from the date this question is created until January 1, 2028. The vote must be officially documented and the results validated by the appropriate national electoral authorities.

(b) A novel chemical method that cuts greenhouse gas emissions by at least 30% compared to current methods must be put into commercial practice between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The implementation must be published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or verified by an authorized governmental entity.

(c) The Chinese government or a Chinese energy firm must make a public declaration regarding the development of a commercial nuclear fusion reactor between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. This announcement must be covered by major news organizations and confirmed by official sources from China.

question.title: Will the European Union implement a new policy mandating electric vehicle adoption targets for member states by January 1, 2028?
question.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if the European Union implements a new policy mandating specific electric vehicle adoption targets for its member states between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The policy must be officially enacted and published in the EU's official records.

not_P.title: Will the European Union not implement a new policy mandating electric vehicle adoption targets for member states by January 1, 2028?
not_P.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if the European Union does not implement a new policy mandating specific electric vehicle adoption targets for its member states between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The policy must not be officially enacted and published in the EU's official records.

para_P.title: Will the European Union introduce a new regulation requiring member countries to set electric vehicle adoption goals by January 1, 2028?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with 'Yes' if the European Union introduces a new regulation that requires its member countries to establish specific electric vehicle adoption goals between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The regulation must be formally enacted and recorded in the official publications of the EU.

question.title: Conditional on the EU mandating electric vehicle adoption targets, will the US House pass nuclear energy legislation by 2028?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: The European Union implements a new policy mandating specific electric vehicle adoption targets for its member states between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, and this policy is officially enacted and published in the EU's official records. Then, will the US House of Representatives pass legislation specifically aimed at advancing nuclear energy technology between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028? The legislation must be officially passed and recorded in the official records of the US House of Representatives.

not_P.title: Conditional on the EU mandating electric vehicle adoption targets, will the US House not pass nuclear energy legislation by 2028?
not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: The European Union implements a new policy mandating specific electric vehicle adoption targets for its member states between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, and this policy is officially enacted and published in the EU's official records. Then, will the US House of Representatives not pass legislation specifically aimed at advancing nuclear energy technology between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028? question.title: Given Elon Musk announces a nuclear fusion project, will a new chemical process neutralize nuclear waste by 2028?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Elon Musk announces a project related to nuclear fusion technology before January 1, 2028. This announcement must be made through an official channel such as a press release, social media, or a public event, and it must occur between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028.

Then, is it true that a new chemical process will be developed and commercially implemented to safely neutralize nuclear waste by January 1, 2028? The process must be developed and implemented between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, documented in scientific literature, and verified by a recognized nuclear regulatory authority.

not_P.title: Given Elon Musk announces a nuclear fusion project, will no new chemical process neutralize nuclear waste by 2028?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Elon Musk announces a project related to nuclear fusion technology before January 1, 2028. This announcement must be made through an official channel such as a press release, social media, or a public event, and it must occur between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028.

Then, is it true that no new chemical process will be developed and commercially implemented to safely neutralize nuclear waste by January 1, 2028? The process must be developed and implemented between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, documented in scientific literature, and verified by a recognized nuclear regulatory authority.

para_P.title: If Elon Musk reveals a nuclear fusion initiative, will there be a new chemical method to neutralize nuclear waste by 2028?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: Elon Musk discloses a venture related to nuclear fusion technology prior to January 1, 2028. This disclosure must occur through an official medium such as a press release, social media, or a public gathering, and it should take place between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028.

Is it then accurate to say that a novel chemical method will be created and put into commercial use to effectively neutralize nuclear waste by January 1, 2028? The method must be established and utilized between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, published in scientific literature, and confirmed by an acknowledged nuclear regulatory body.

question.title: Given both Elon Musk announces a nuclear fusion project and a new process for neutralizing nuclear waste is implemented, will South Korea and North Korea sign a peace treaty by 2028?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both of the following occur between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028: (a) Elon Musk announces a project related to nuclear fusion technology, with the announcement made through an official channel such as a press release, social media, or a public event; and (b) a new chemical process is developed and commercially implemented to safely neutralize nuclear waste, with the process documented in scientific literature and verified by a recognized nuclear regulatory authority. 

Then, will South Korea and North Korea sign a formal peace treaty between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028? The treaty must be officially recognized by both governments and documented by reputable international organizations.

not_P.title: Given both Elon Musk does not announce a nuclear fusion project or a new process for neutralizing nuclear waste is not implemented, will South Korea or North Korea not sign a peace treaty by 2028?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: At least one of the following does not occur between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028: (a) Elon Musk does not announce a project related to nuclear fusion technology, with the announcement made through an official channel such as a press release, social media, or a public event; or (b) a new chemical process is not developed and commercially implemented to safely neutralize nuclear waste, with the process not documented in scientific literature and not verified by a recognized nuclear regulatory authority. 

Then, will South Korea and North Korea not sign a formal peace treaty between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028? The treaty must be officially recognized by both governments and documented by reputable international organizations.

para_P.title: If both Elon Musk unveils a nuclear fusion initiative and a novel method for disposing of nuclear waste is put into practice, will a peace agreement be reached between South Korea and North Korea by the year 2028?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following conditions are met: During the period from October 1, 2024, to January 1, 2028, both of these events occur: (a) Elon Musk reveals a project concerning nuclear fusion technology through an official medium such as a press release, social media, or a public event; and (b) a new chemical method is created and put into commercial use to effectively neutralize nuclear waste, with this method recorded in scientific publications and validated by a recognized nuclear oversight authority. 

Then, will South Korea and North Korea establish a formal peace treaty during the timeframe from October 1, 2024, to January 1, 2028? This treaty must be acknowledged by both nations and documented by credible international organizations.

question.title: Will all of the following occur by January 1, 2028: (1) Elon Musk announces a project related to nuclear fusion technology, (2) a new chemical process is developed and commercially implemented to safely neutralize nuclear waste, and (3) South Korea and North Korea sign a formal peace treaty?
question.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if all of the following occur between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028: (1) Elon Musk announces a project related to nuclear fusion technology, with the announcement made through an official channel such as a press release, social media, or a public event; (2) a new chemical process is developed and commercially implemented to safely neutralize nuclear waste, with the process documented in scientific literature and verified by a recognized nuclear regulatory authority; and (3) South Korea and North Korea sign a formal peace treaty, with the treaty officially recognized by both governments and documented by reputable international organizations.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur by January 1, 2028: (1) Elon Musk does not announce a project related to nuclear fusion technology, (2) a new chemical process is not developed and commercially implemented to safely neutralize nuclear waste, or (3) South Korea and North Korea do not sign a formal peace treaty?
not_P.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if not all of the following occur between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028: (1) Elon Musk does not announce a project related to nuclear fusion technology, with the announcement not made through an official channel such as a press release, social media, or a public event; (2) a new chemical process is not developed and commercially implemented to safely neutralize nuclear waste, with the process not documented in scientific literature and not verified by a recognized nuclear regulatory authority; and (3) South Korea and North Korea do not sign a formal peace treaty, with the treaty not officially recognized by both governments and not documented by reputable international organizations.

para_P.title: Is it possible that by January 1, 2028, the following will take place: (1) Elon Musk reveals a project concerning nuclear fusion technology, (2) an innovative chemical method is created and put into practice to safely dispose of nuclear waste, and (3) a formal peace agreement is reached between South Korea and North Korea?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with 'Yes' if all of the subsequent events transpire between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028: (1) Elon Musk reveals a project related to nuclear fusion technology through an official medium such as a press release, social media, or a public event; (2) an innovative chemical method is developed and successfully applied to safely neutralize nuclear waste, with the method published in scientific literature and validated by an acknowledged nuclear regulatory body; and (3) South Korea and North Korea finalize a formal peace agreement, with the treaty officially acknowledged by both nations and recorded by credible international organizations.

question.title: Will the Democratic Party (US) propose legislation regulating AI technologies before January 1, 2028?
question.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if the Democratic Party in the United States proposes any legislation specifically aimed at regulating artificial intelligence technologies between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The proposal must be formally introduced in either the House of Representatives or the Senate and be documented in official congressional records.

not_P.title: Will the Democratic Party (US) not propose legislation regulating AI technologies before January 1, 2028?
not_P.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if the Democratic Party in the United States does not propose any legislation specifically aimed at regulating artificial intelligence technologies between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The proposal must not be formally introduced in either the House of Representatives or the Senate and must not be documented in official congressional records.

para_P.title: Will the Democratic Party in the United States introduce laws governing AI technologies prior to January 1, 2028?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with 'Yes' if the Democratic Party in the US puts forward any legislation specifically targeting the regulation of artificial intelligence technologies from October 1, 2024, to January 1, 2028. The legislation needs to be officially presented in either the House of Representatives or the Senate and recorded in congressional documentation.

question.title: Conditional on the Democratic Party proposing AI regulation legislation, will AI be used to analyze player performance in a major soccer tournament by 2028?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Democratic Party in the United States proposes legislation specifically aimed at regulating artificial intelligence technologies between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The proposal must be formally introduced in either the House of Representatives or the Senate and be documented in official congressional records.

Then, is it true that an AI-driven system will be officially used to analyze player performance in a major international soccer tournament before January 1, 2028? This will resolve as 'Yes' if, between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, an AI-driven system is officially used to analyze player performance in a major international soccer tournament, confirmed by an official announcement from the tournament organizers or a reputable news source.

not_P.title: Conditional on the Democratic Party proposing AI regulation legislation, will AI not be used to analyze player performance in a major soccer tournament by 2028?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Democratic Party in the United States proposes legislation specifically aimed at regulating artificial intelligence technologies between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The proposal must be formally introduced in either the House of Representatives or the Senate and be documented in official congressional records.

Then, is it true that an AI-driven system will not be officially used to analyze player performance in a major international soccer tournament before January 1, 2028? This will resolve as 'Yes' if, between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, an AI-driven system is not officially used to analyze player performance in a major international soccer tournament, confirmed by an official announcement from the tournament organizers or a reputable news source.

para_P.title: If the Democratic Party puts forward legislation for AI regulation, will there be an application of AI to evaluate player performance in a significant soccer tournament by the year 2028?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: The Democratic Party in the United States puts forth a legislative proposal specifically targeting the regulation of artificial intelligence technologies during the period from October 1, 2024, to January 1, 2028. This proposal must be officially presented in either the House of Representatives or the Senate and recorded in official congressional documentation.

Then, can it be confirmed that an AI-based system will be officially utilized to assess player performance in a major international soccer tournament prior to January 1, 2028? This will be marked as 'Yes' if, within the timeframe of October 1, 2024, to January 1, 2028, an AI-based system is officially employed to evaluate player performance in a major international soccer tournament, as verified by an official statement from the tournament organizers or a credible news outlet.

question.title: Given both AI regulation legislation by Democrats and AI in soccer occur, will SCOTUS rule on ACA constitutionality by 2028?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both of the following occur before January 1, 2028: (a) The Democratic Party in the United States proposes legislation regulating artificial intelligence technologies, formally introduced in either the House of Representatives or the Senate and documented in official congressional records. (b) An AI-driven system is officially used to analyze player performance in a major international soccer tournament, confirmed by an official announcement from the tournament organizers or a reputable news source.

Then, will the Supreme Court of the United States issue a ruling on a case that directly challenges the constitutionality of the Affordable Care Act between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, with the ruling officially documented in SCOTUS records?

not_P.title: Given both AI regulation legislation by Democrats and AI in soccer do not occur, will SCOTUS not rule on ACA constitutionality by 2028?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both of the following do not occur before January 1, 2028: (a) The Democratic Party in the United States does not propose legislation regulating artificial intelligence technologies, formally introduced in either the House of Representatives or the Senate and documented in official congressional records. (b) An AI-driven system is not officially used to analyze player performance in a major international soccer tournament, confirmed by an official announcement from the tournament organizers or a reputable news source.

Then, will the Supreme Court of the United States not issue a ruling on a case that directly challenges the constitutionality of the Affordable Care Act between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, with the ruling not officially documented in SCOTUS records?

para_P.title: If both AI regulation legislation by Democrats and AI in soccer take place, will SCOTUS make a decision on ACA constitutionality by 2028?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Before January 1, 2028, both of these events occur: (a) The Democratic Party in the United States puts forward a bill to regulate artificial intelligence technologies, which is formally presented in either the House of Representatives or the Senate and recorded in official congressional documents. (b) An AI-based system is officially deployed to evaluate player performance during a significant international soccer tournament, as confirmed by an official statement from the tournament organizers or a credible news outlet.

In that case, will the Supreme Court of the United States render a decision on a case that directly questions the constitutionality of the Affordable Care Act between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, with the decision officially noted in SCOTUS records?

question.title: Will Japan's GDP growth rate exceed 3% in any year from 2025 to 2027?
question.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if Japan's annual GDP growth rate exceeds 3% in any calendar year from January 1, 2025, to December 31, 2027. The GDP growth rate will be determined based on official data released by the World Bank or the International Monetary Fund (IMF).

not_P.title: Will Japan's GDP growth rate not exceed 3% in any year from 2025 to 2027?
not_P.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if Japan's annual GDP growth rate does not exceed 3% in any calendar year from January 1, 2025, to December 31, 2027. The GDP growth rate will be determined based on official data released by the World Bank or the International Monetary Fund (IMF).

para_P.title: Is it possible for Japan's GDP growth rate to surpass 3% during any year between 2025 and 2027?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with 'Yes' if Japan's yearly GDP growth rate goes beyond 3% in any calendar year from January 1, 2025, to December 31, 2027. The determination of the GDP growth rate will rely on official statistics published by the World Bank or the International Monetary Fund (IMF).

question.title: Given Japan's GDP growth rate exceeds 3% in any year from 2025 to 2027, will Sweden decommission at least one nuclear reactor before January 1, 2028?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Japan's annual GDP growth rate exceeds 3% in any calendar year from January 1, 2025, to December 31, 2027. The GDP growth rate is determined based on official data released by the World Bank or the International Monetary Fund (IMF).

Then, will Sweden decommission at least one nuclear reactor before January 1, 2028? This question resolves as 'Yes' if, between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, Sweden decommissions at least one nuclear reactor. The decommissioning must be officially recognized by the Swedish Radiation Safety Authority (SSM), and verification will be based on official announcements from the SSM.

not_P.title: Given Japan's GDP growth rate does not exceed 3% in any year from 2025 to 2027, will Sweden not decommission at least one nuclear reactor before January 1, 2028?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Japan's annual GDP growth rate does not exceed 3% in any calendar year from January 1, 2025, to December 31, 2027. The GDP growth rate is determined based on official data released by the World Bank or the International Monetary Fund (IMF).

Then, will Sweden not decommission at least one nuclear reactor before January 1, 2028? This question resolves as 'Yes' if, between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, Sweden does not decommission at least one nuclear reactor. The decommissioning must be officially recognized by the Swedish Radiation Safety Authority (SSM), and verification will be based on official announcements from the SSM.

para_P.title: If Japan's economic growth rate is above 3% in any year between 2025 and 2027, will Sweden retire at least one nuclear power plant prior to January 1, 2028?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Japan's yearly economic growth rate is greater than 3% in any year from January 1, 2025, to December 31, 2027. This growth rate is assessed based on official statistics from the World Bank or the International Monetary Fund (IMF).

Then, will Sweden retire at least one nuclear power plant before January 1, 2028? This inquiry is answered with 'Yes' if, during the period from October 1, 2024, to January 1, 2028, Sweden retires at least one nuclear power plant. The retirement must be officially acknowledged by the Swedish Radiation Safety Authority (SSM), and confirmation will rely on formal announcements from the SSM.

question.title: Given that Japan's GDP growth exceeds 3% in any year from 2025 to 2027 and Sweden decommissions a nuclear reactor before 2028, will OpenAI release a tool to reduce carbon emissions before 2028?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both of these conditions are met: (a) Japan's annual GDP growth rate exceeds 3% in any calendar year from January 1, 2025, to December 31, 2027, based on official data released by the World Bank or the International Monetary Fund (IMF). (b) Sweden decommissions at least one nuclear reactor between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, with the decommissioning officially recognized by the Swedish Radiation Safety Authority (SSM) and verified through official announcements from the SSM.

Then, will OpenAI release a tool specifically designed to reduce carbon emissions in any industry between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028? The tool must be publicly announced and available for use, with its primary function being the reduction of carbon emissions.

not_P.title: Given that Japan's GDP growth does not exceed 3% in any year from 2025 to 2027 or Sweden does not decommission a nuclear reactor before 2028, will OpenAI not release a tool to reduce carbon emissions before 2028?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: At least one of these conditions is not met: (a) Japan's annual GDP growth rate does not exceed 3% in any calendar year from January 1, 2025, to December 31, 2027, based on official data released by the World Bank or the International Monetary Fund (IMF). (b) Sweden does not decommission any nuclear reactor between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, with the decommissioning not officially recognized by the Swedish Radiation Safety Authority (SSM) or not verified through official announcements from the SSM.

Then, will OpenAI not release a tool specifically designed to reduce carbon emissions in any industry between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028? The tool must not be publicly announced and available for use, with its primary function not being the reduction of carbon emissions.

para_P.title: Assuming Japan's GDP growth remains above 3% in any year between 2025 and 2027 and that Sweden shuts down a nuclear reactor prior to 2028, will OpenAI unveil a tool aimed at lowering carbon emissions before the year 2028?
para_P.body:
Let’s consider the following conditions as true: Both of these criteria are satisfied: (a) Japan's yearly GDP growth rate is greater than 3% in any calendar year from January 1, 2025, to December 31, 2027, according to official statistics from the World Bank or the International Monetary Fund (IMF). (b) Sweden decommissions at least one nuclear reactor between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, with the decommissioning officially acknowledged by the Swedish Radiation Safety Authority (SSM) and confirmed through official communications from the SSM.

Under these circumstances, will OpenAI launch a tool specifically intended to decrease carbon emissions across any industry between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028? This tool must be publicly announced and accessible, with its main purpose being the reduction of carbon emissions.

question.title: Given Japan's GDP growth exceeds 3% in any year from 2025 to 2027 and China-Taiwan diplomatic talks occur, will the immunology drug market exceed $150 billion by 2028?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) Japan's annual GDP growth rate exceeds 3% in any calendar year from January 1, 2025, to December 31, 2027, according to official data released by the World Bank or the International Monetary Fund (IMF); and (2) between the creation date of October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, China and Taiwan engage in formal diplomatic talks aimed explicitly at resolving their political status, with the talks officially documented and verified by official government sources from either China or Taiwan.

Then, will the global market for immunology drugs exceed $150 billion in annual revenue by January 1, 2028? This will be resolved as 'Yes' if the global market for immunology drugs exceeds $150 billion in annual revenue at any point between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The revenue must be reported by a reliable market research firm or financial news source.
