question.title: Conditional on Ukraine holding an EU referendum and announcing a new nuclear plant before 2028, will Ukraine join the EU by 2028?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before January 1, 2028, Ukraine holds a national referendum on joining the European Union, and Ukraine officially announces the construction of a new nuclear power plant. 

Resolution criteria for the condition: 
- The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Ukrainian government, with results publicly available.
- The nuclear plant announcement must include specific plans for location and capacity, made through official government channels.

Given these conditions, will Ukraine officially become a member of the European Union by January 1, 2028? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Ukraine must be formally recognized as a member by both Ukraine and the EU, documented in official records, between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028.

not_P.title: Conditional on Ukraine holding an EU referendum and announcing a new nuclear plant before 2028, will Ukraine not join the EU by 2028?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before January 1, 2028, Ukraine holds a national referendum on joining the European Union, and Ukraine officially announces the construction of a new nuclear power plant. 

Resolution criteria for the condition: 
- The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Ukrainian government, with results publicly available.
- The nuclear plant announcement must include specific plans for location and capacity, made through official government channels.

Given these conditions, will Ukraine not officially become a member of the European Union by January 1, 2028? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Ukraine must not be formally recognized as a member by both Ukraine and the EU, documented in official records, between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028.

para_P.title: If Ukraine conducts an EU membership referendum and reveals a new nuclear facility prior to 2028, will it become an EU member by that year?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Before the date of January 1, 2028, Ukraine carries out a national vote regarding its membership in the European Union, and simultaneously, Ukraine makes a formal declaration about the establishment of a new nuclear power facility. 

Criteria for assessing the condition: 
- The referendum must be officially declared and executed by the Ukrainian authorities, with the results made publicly accessible.
- The announcement regarding the nuclear power plant must detail its proposed location and capacity, communicated through recognized government channels.

Under these stipulations, will Ukraine be officially acknowledged as a member of the European Union by January 1, 2028? 

Criteria for determining the outcome: Ukraine must receive formal recognition as a member from both itself and the EU, as recorded in official documentation, within the timeframe of October 1, 2024, to January 1, 2028.

question.title: Will all of the following occur in Ukraine before January 1, 2028: (a) a national referendum on joining the European Union, (b) an official announcement of the construction of a new nuclear power plant, and (c) Ukraine joins the European Union?
question.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if all of the following events occur between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028: (a) Ukraine holds a national referendum on joining the European Union. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Ukrainian government and the results must be publicly available. (b) Ukraine officially announces the construction of a new nuclear power plant. The announcement must be made through official government channels and include specific plans for the plant's location and capacity. (c) Ukraine officially becomes a member of the European Union. The membership must be formally recognized by both Ukraine and the European Union and documented in their official records.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur in Ukraine before January 1, 2028: (a) a national referendum on joining the European Union, (b) an official announcement of the construction of a new nuclear power plant, and (c) Ukraine does not join the European Union?
not_P.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if not all of the following events occur between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028: (a) Ukraine does not hold a national referendum on joining the European Union. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Ukrainian government and the results must be publicly available. (b) Ukraine does not officially announce the construction of a new nuclear power plant. The announcement must be made through official government channels and include specific plans for the plant's location and capacity. (c) Ukraine does not officially become a member of the European Union. The membership must be formally recognized by both Ukraine and the European Union and documented in their official records.

para_P.title: Will Ukraine experience all of the following events prior to January 1, 2028: (a) a public vote regarding EU membership, (b) a formal declaration about a new nuclear facility's construction, and (c) Ukraine's accession to the European Union?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with 'Yes' if all of the specified events take place between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028: (a) Ukraine conducts a public vote on EU membership, which must be officially announced and carried out by the Ukrainian authorities, with the results made publicly accessible. (b) Ukraine makes a formal announcement regarding the establishment of a new nuclear power station, communicated through official government channels, detailing the location and capacity of the facility. (c) Ukraine officially joins the European Union, with this membership being formally acknowledged by both Ukraine and the EU, and recorded in their official documentation.

question.title: Will any new pharmacological treatment for climate change-induced health conditions be approved by the FDA by January 1, 2028?
question.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if the FDA approves any new pharmacological treatment specifically for health conditions induced by climate change between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The approval must be officially announced by the FDA and documented in their records.

not_P.title: Will no new pharmacological treatment for climate change-induced health conditions be approved by the FDA by January 1, 2028?
not_P.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if the FDA does not approve any new pharmacological treatment specifically for health conditions induced by climate change between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The approval must be officially announced by the FDA and documented in their records.

para_P.title: Will the FDA authorize any novel medication aimed at health issues caused by climate change before January 1, 2028?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed 'Yes' if the FDA grants approval for any novel medication specifically targeting health issues resulting from climate change within the timeframe of October 1, 2024, to January 1, 2028. The approval must be formally declared by the FDA and recorded in their official documentation.

question.title: Given a new pharmacological treatment for climate change-induced health conditions is approved by the FDA, will Spain commission a new nuclear power plant before January 1, 2028?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: The FDA approves a new pharmacological treatment specifically for health conditions induced by climate change between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, with the approval officially announced and documented by the FDA. Then, will Spain officially commission and begin commercial operation of a new nuclear power plant between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, with confirmation from the relevant Spanish regulatory authority?

not_P.title: Given a new pharmacological treatment for climate change-induced health conditions is approved by the FDA, will Spain not commission a new nuclear power plant before January 1, 2028?
not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: The FDA approves a new pharmacological treatment specifically for health conditions induced by climate change between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, with the approval officially announced and documented by the FDA. Then, will Spain not officially commission and begin commercial operation of a new nuclear power plant between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, with confirmation from the relevant Spanish regulatory authority?

para_P.title: If the FDA authorizes a novel medication for health issues caused by climate change, will Spain initiate the commissioning of a new nuclear power facility prior to January 1, 2028?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds true: The FDA grants authorization for a novel medication aimed at treating health issues resulting from climate change at some point between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, with official documentation and announcement from the FDA. Will Spain then proceed to officially commission and commence the commercial operation of a new nuclear power facility in the timeframe from October 1, 2024, to January 1, 2028, as confirmed by the appropriate regulatory body in Spain?

question.title: Given both FDA approval for climate change health treatment and Spain's nuclear plant commissioning by 2028, will Switzerland cut emissions by 50%?
question.body:
Suppose both of the following occur by January 1, 2028:

(a) The FDA approves a new pharmacological treatment specifically for health conditions induced by climate change, with the approval officially announced and documented by the FDA.

(b) A new nuclear power plant is officially commissioned and begins commercial operation in Spain, confirmed by an official announcement from the relevant Spanish regulatory authority.

Then, will Switzerland achieve a 50% reduction in greenhouse gas emissions from 1990 levels by January 1, 2028? This requires Switzerland to achieve the reduction at any point between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, with confirmation by official data from the Swiss Federal Office for the Environment (FOEN) or another authorized governmental body.

not_P.title: Given both FDA approval for climate change health treatment and Spain's nuclear plant commissioning by 2028, will Switzerland not cut emissions by 50%?
not_P.body:
Suppose both of the following occur by January 1, 2028:

(a) The FDA approves a new pharmacological treatment specifically for health conditions induced by climate change, with the approval officially announced and documented by the FDA.

(b) A new nuclear power plant is officially commissioned and begins commercial operation in Spain, confirmed by an official announcement from the relevant Spanish regulatory authority.

Then, will Switzerland not achieve a 50% reduction in greenhouse gas emissions from 1990 levels by January 1, 2028? This requires Switzerland to not achieve the reduction at any point between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, with confirmation by official data from the Swiss Federal Office for the Environment (FOEN) or another authorized governmental body.

para_P.title: If the FDA grants approval for a treatment addressing health issues caused by climate change and Spain's nuclear facility is operational by 2028, will Switzerland reduce its emissions by half?
para_P.body:
Imagine that both of the following events take place by January 1, 2028:

(a) The FDA gives its approval for a new medication aimed at health problems resulting from climate change, with this approval being officially announced and recorded by the FDA.

(b) A new nuclear energy facility is officially activated and starts commercial operations in Spain, as confirmed by an official statement from the appropriate Spanish regulatory body.

In that case, will Switzerland reach a 50% decrease in greenhouse gas emissions compared to 1990 levels by January 1, 2028? This means that Switzerland needs to accomplish this reduction at any time between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, with verification through official data from the Swiss Federal Office for the Environment (FOEN) or another recognized government agency.

question.title: Will all of the following occur by January 1, 2028: (a) the FDA approves a new pharmacological treatment for climate change-induced health conditions, (b) Spain commissions a new nuclear power plant, and (c) Switzerland achieves a 50% reduction in greenhouse gas emissions from 1990 levels?
question.body:
This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if all of the following events occur between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028:

(a) The FDA approves a new pharmacological treatment specifically for health conditions induced by climate change. The approval must be officially announced by the FDA and documented in their records.

(b) A new nuclear power plant is officially commissioned and begins commercial operation in Spain. The commissioning must be confirmed by an official announcement from the relevant Spanish regulatory authority.

(c) Switzerland achieves a 50% reduction in greenhouse gas emissions from 1990 levels. The reduction must be confirmed by official data released by the Swiss Federal Office for the Environment (FOEN) or another authorized governmental body.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur by January 1, 2028: (a) the FDA does not approve a new pharmacological treatment for climate change-induced health conditions, (b) Spain does not commission a new nuclear power plant, or (c) Switzerland does not achieve a 50% reduction in greenhouse gas emissions from 1990 levels?
not_P.body:
This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if at least one of the following events does not occur between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028:

(a) The FDA does not approve a new pharmacological treatment specifically for health conditions induced by climate change. The approval must not be officially announced by the FDA and documented in their records.

(b) A new nuclear power plant is not officially commissioned and does not begin commercial operation in Spain. The commissioning must not be confirmed by an official announcement from the relevant Spanish regulatory authority.

(c) Switzerland does not achieve a 50% reduction in greenhouse gas emissions from 1990 levels. The reduction must not be confirmed by official data released by the Swiss Federal Office for the Environment (FOEN) or another authorized governmental body.

para_P.title: By January 1, 2028, will the following take place: (a) the FDA grants approval for a novel pharmacological solution for health issues caused by climate change, (b) Spain inaugurates a new nuclear energy facility, and (c) Switzerland reaches a 50% decrease in greenhouse gas emissions compared to 1990 levels?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with 'Yes' if all the subsequent events happen between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028:

(a) The FDA grants approval for a new medication specifically targeting health issues caused by climate change. This approval must be officially declared by the FDA and recorded in their documentation.

(b) A new nuclear energy facility is officially inaugurated and starts commercial operations in Spain. The inauguration must be verified by an official announcement from the appropriate Spanish regulatory body.

(c) Switzerland attains a 50% reduction in greenhouse gas emissions from levels recorded in 1990. This reduction must be validated by official statistics published by the Swiss Federal Office for the Environment (FOEN) or another recognized governmental entity.

question.title: Will Elon Musk announce a large-scale reforestation project involving at least 1 million trees before January 1, 2028?
question.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if Elon Musk publicly announces a large-scale reforestation project involving the planting of at least 1 million trees between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The announcement must be made through official channels such as Musk's verified social media accounts or official statements from his companies.

not_P.title: Will Elon Musk not announce a large-scale reforestation project involving at least 1 million trees before January 1, 2028?
not_P.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if Elon Musk does not publicly announce a large-scale reforestation project involving the planting of at least 1 million trees between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The announcement must not be made through official channels such as Musk's verified social media accounts or official statements from his companies.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Elon Musk will reveal a significant reforestation initiative that includes the planting of no fewer than 1 million trees prior to January 1, 2028?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed 'Yes' if Elon Musk makes a public declaration regarding a substantial reforestation effort that involves the planting of at least 1 million trees sometime between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The announcement must occur through official means, such as Musk's verified social media platforms or formal communications from his companies.

question.title: Given Elon Musk announces a large-scale reforestation project, will Japan announce a new nuclear power plant?

Will Japan then make an official statement about the establishment of a new nuclear power facility prior to January 1, 2028? question.title: Conditional on both Elon Musk announcing a large-scale reforestation project and Japan announcing a new nuclear power plant before January 1, 2028, will NASA announce a partnership with a private company to develop a commercial space station before January 1, 2028?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Both of the following occur before January 1, 2028: (a) Elon Musk publicly announces a large-scale reforestation project involving the planting of at least 1 million trees, through official channels such as Musk's verified social media accounts or official statements from his companies, and (b) Japan officially announces the construction of a new nuclear power plant through official government channels and documented in public records. Then is it true that NASA will announce a partnership with a private company to develop a commercial space station between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028? The NASA announcement must be made through official NASA channels and be covered by major news outlets.

not_P.title: Conditional on either Elon Musk not announcing a large-scale reforestation project or Japan not announcing a new nuclear power plant before January 1, 2028, will NASA not announce a partnership with a private company to develop a commercial space station before January 1, 2028?

question.title: Will an artificial intelligence system developed or funded by Elon Musk's companies pass a formally administered Turing Test before January 1, 2028?
question.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if, before January 1, 2028, an artificial intelligence system developed or funded by any of Elon Musk's companies (such as Tesla, SpaceX, Neuralink, or OpenAI) passes a formally administered Turing Test. The test must be judged by a panel of at least 5 recognized experts in the field of AI, conducted under controlled conditions, and the results must be published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal.

not_P.title: Will an artificial intelligence system developed or funded by Elon Musk's companies not pass a formally administered Turing Test before January 1, 2028?
not_P.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if, before January 1, 2028, an artificial intelligence system developed or funded by any of Elon Musk's companies (such as Tesla, SpaceX, Neuralink, or OpenAI) does not pass a formally administered Turing Test. The test must be judged by a panel of at least 5 recognized experts in the field of AI, conducted under controlled conditions, and the results must be published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal.

para_P.title: Will an AI system created or financed by companies owned by Elon Musk succeed in a formal Turing Test prior to January 1, 2028?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed 'Yes' if, before January 1, 2028, an AI system created or financed by any of Elon Musk's enterprises (including Tesla, SpaceX, Neuralink, or OpenAI) successfully passes a formal Turing Test. The evaluation must be conducted by a panel of no fewer than 5 acknowledged experts in AI, performed under regulated conditions, and the findings must be published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal.

question.title: Given an AI system by Musk's companies passes a Turing Test by 2028, will Tesla deploy a fully autonomous vehicle fleet in Mexico by 2028?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before January 1, 2028, an artificial intelligence system developed or funded by any of Elon Musk's companies (such as Tesla, SpaceX, Neuralink, or OpenAI) passes a formally administered Turing Test. The test must be judged by a panel of at least 5 recognized experts in the field of AI, conducted under controlled conditions, and the results must be published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal.

Then, will Tesla officially deploy a fleet of fully autonomous vehicles (Level 5 autonomy) for commercial use in Mexico between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028? The deployment must be confirmed through an official announcement by Tesla and reported by reputable news sources.

not_P.title: Given an AI system by Musk's companies does not pass a Turing Test by 2028, will Tesla not deploy a fully autonomous vehicle fleet in Mexico by 2028?

Then, will Tesla not officially deploy a fleet of fully autonomous vehicles (Level 5 autonomy) for commercial use in Mexico between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028? The deployment must be confirmed through an official announcement by Tesla and reported by reputable news sources.

para_P.title: If an AI system from Musk's companies successfully completes a Turing Test by 2028, will Tesla launch a completely self-driving vehicle fleet in Mexico by that same year?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Prior to January 1, 2028, an artificial intelligence system created or financed by any of Elon Musk's enterprises (including Tesla, SpaceX, Neuralink, or OpenAI) successfully passes a formally conducted Turing Test. This test must be evaluated by a panel of no fewer than 5 acknowledged experts in the AI domain, carried out under regulated conditions, and the findings must be published in a peer-reviewed academic journal.

Then, will Tesla officially roll out a fleet of fully self-driving vehicles (Level 5 autonomy) for commercial operations in Mexico sometime between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028? The launch must be validated through an official statement from Tesla and covered by credible news outlets.

question.title: Given both an AI system from Elon Musk's companies passes a Turing Test and Tesla deploys a fully autonomous vehicle fleet in Mexico before January 1, 2028, will India implement a national policy on AI ethics by then?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true before January 1, 2028: (a) An artificial intelligence system developed or funded by any of Elon Musk's companies (such as Tesla, SpaceX, Neuralink, or OpenAI) passes a formally administered Turing Test. The test must be judged by a panel of at least 5 recognized experts in the field of AI, conducted under controlled conditions, and the results must be published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal. (b) Tesla officially deploys a fleet of fully autonomous vehicles (Level 5 autonomy) for commercial use in Mexico between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The deployment must be confirmed through an official announcement by Tesla and reported by reputable news sources.

Then, will India implement a national policy on artificial intelligence ethics before January 1, 2028? This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if, between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, the Government of India officially implements a national policy specifically addressing the ethics of artificial intelligence. The policy must be officially published and enacted by the government.

not_P.title: Given both an AI system from Elon Musk's companies does not pass a Turing Test and Tesla does not deploy a fully autonomous vehicle fleet in Mexico before January 1, 2028, will India not implement a national policy on AI ethics by then?

This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if, between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, the Government of India does not officially implement a national policy specifically addressing the ethics of artificial intelligence. para_P.title: If an AI system from Elon Musk's businesses successfully completes a Turing Test and Tesla launches a completely self-driving vehicle fleet in Mexico prior to January 1, 2028, will India establish a national AI ethics policy by that date?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following conditions hold true before January 1, 2028: (a) An AI system created or supported by any of Elon Musk's enterprises (including Tesla, SpaceX, Neuralink, or OpenAI) successfully passes a formally conducted Turing Test, evaluated by a panel of at least five acknowledged AI experts, carried out in controlled settings, with the findings published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal. (b) Tesla formally rolls out a fleet of fully autonomous vehicles (Level 5 autonomy) for commercial use in Mexico between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, with the deployment confirmed through an official Tesla announcement and reported by credible news outlets.

Then, will India put into place a national policy on the ethics of artificial intelligence before January 1, 2028? This question will be answered as 'Yes' if, between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, the Indian government officially enacts a national policy that specifically addresses AI ethics, which must be published and implemented by the government.

question.title: Will all of the following occur before January 1, 2028: (1) An AI system from Elon Musk's companies passes a Turing Test, (2) Tesla deploys a fully autonomous vehicle fleet in Mexico, and (3) India implements a national policy on artificial intelligence ethics?
question.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if all of the following conditions are met before January 1, 2028: (1) An artificial intelligence system developed or funded by any of Elon Musk's companies (such as Tesla, SpaceX, Neuralink, or OpenAI) passes a formally administered Turing Test. para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with 'Yes' if the subsequent conditions are satisfied before January 1, 2028: (1) An artificial intelligence system created or financed by any of Elon Musk's enterprises (like Tesla, SpaceX, Neuralink, or OpenAI) successfully passes a formally conducted Turing Test. This test must be evaluated by a panel of no fewer than 5 recognized authorities in the AI domain, carried out under controlled settings, and the findings must be published in a peer-reviewed academic journal. question.title: Given that (a) Vladimir Putin remains President of Russia until January 1, 2028, and (b) the US passes a federal AI regulation law before January 1, 2028, will Canada hold a federal election before January 1, 2028?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Vladimir Putin remains the President of Russia continuously from October 1, 2024, to January 1, 2028, based on official announcements from the Russian government and reputable news sources; and (b) the United States Congress passes a federal law specifically regulating the use of artificial intelligence in critical infrastructure (such as power grids, water supply systems, or transportation networks) between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, with the law signed by the President and publicly documented in official government records.

Then, will Canada hold a federal election between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, officially recognized by Elections Canada and documented on their official website?

not_P.title: Given that (a) Vladimir Putin does not remain President of Russia until January 1, 2028, or (b) the US does not pass a federal AI regulation law before January 1, 2028, will Canada not hold a federal election before January 1, 2028?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Vladimir Putin does not remain the President of Russia continuously from October 1, 2024, to January 1, 2028, based on official announcements from the Russian government and reputable news sources; or (b) the United States Congress does not pass a federal law specifically regulating the use of artificial intelligence in critical infrastructure (such as power grids, water supply systems, or transportation networks) between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, with the law not signed by the President and not publicly documented in official government records.

Then, will Canada not hold a federal election between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, officially recognized by Elections Canada and not documented on their official website?

para_P.title: Assuming (a) Vladimir Putin continues to be the President of Russia until January 1, 2028, and (b) the US enacts a federal law regulating AI before January 1, 2028, will Canada conduct a federal election prior to January 1, 2028?
para_P.body:
Let us consider the following conditions: (a) Vladimir Putin remains in the role of President of Russia from October 1, 2024, to January 1, 2028, as confirmed by official statements from the Russian government and credible news outlets; and (b) the United States Congress enacts a federal statute that specifically governs the application of artificial intelligence in essential services (including electricity grids, water supply systems, or transportation systems) between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, with the law being signed by the President and officially recorded in government documentation.

Under these circumstances, will Canada hold a federal election between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, that is officially acknowledged by Elections Canada and listed on their official website?

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Vladimir Putin remains President of Russia until January 1, 2028, (b) the United States passes a federal law regulating the use of artificial intelligence in critical infrastructure before January 1, 2028, and (c) Canada holds a federal election before January 1, 2028?
question.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if all of the following conditions are met: (a) Vladimir Putin remains the President of Russia continuously from October 1, 2024, to January 1, 2028, based on official announcements from the Russian government and reputable news sources; (b) the United States Congress passes a federal law specifically regulating the use of artificial intelligence in critical infrastructure (such as power grids, water supply systems, or transportation networks) between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, with the law signed by the President and publicly documented in official government records; and (c) Canada holds a federal election between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The election must be officially recognized by Elections Canada and documented on their official website.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) Vladimir Putin does not remain President of Russia until January 1, 2028, (b) the United States does not pass a federal law regulating the use of artificial intelligence in critical infrastructure before January 1, 2028, or (c) Canada does not hold a federal election before January 1, 2028?
not_P.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if at least one of the following conditions is met: (a) Vladimir Putin does not remain the President of Russia continuously from October 1, 2024, to January 1, 2028, based on official announcements from the Russian government and reputable news sources; (b) the United States Congress does not pass a federal law specifically regulating the use of artificial intelligence in critical infrastructure (such as power grids, water supply systems, or transportation networks) between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, with the law not signed by the President or not publicly documented in official government records; or (c) Canada does not hold a federal election between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The election must not be officially recognized by Elections Canada or not documented on their official website.

para_P.title: Will the following events take place: (a) Vladimir Putin stays in office as President of Russia until January 1, 2028, (b) the United States enacts a federal statute governing the application of artificial intelligence in essential infrastructure prior to January 1, 2028, and (c) Canada conducts a federal election before January 1, 2028?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with 'Yes' if all of the subsequent criteria are satisfied: (a) Vladimir Putin remains in the position of President of Russia without interruption from October 1, 2024, to January 1, 2028, as confirmed by official statements from the Russian government and credible news outlets; (b) the United States Congress enacts a federal law that specifically regulates the use of artificial intelligence in critical infrastructure (including power grids, water supply systems, or transportation networks) between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, with the legislation signed by the President and officially recorded in government documents; and (c) Canada holds a federal election between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. This election must be officially acknowledged by Elections Canada and recorded on their official website.

question.title: Will a nuclear-powered quantum computing facility be operational before January 1, 2028?
question.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if a quantum computing facility powered by nuclear energy becomes operational at any point between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The facility must be officially inaugurated and operational, with confirmation from both the operating company and a reputable news source.

not_P.title: Will a nuclear-powered quantum computing facility not be operational before January 1, 2028?
not_P.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if a quantum computing facility powered by nuclear energy does not become operational at any point between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The facility must not be officially inaugurated and operational, with no confirmation from both the operating company and a reputable news source.

para_P.title: Will there be a functioning quantum computing plant powered by nuclear energy prior to January 1, 2028?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with 'Yes' if a quantum computing plant that utilizes nuclear energy is functioning at any time from October 1, 2024, through January 1, 2028. The plant must be officially launched and in operation, with validation from both the managing company and a reliable news outlet.

question.title: Given a nuclear-powered quantum computing facility is operational before January 1, 2028, will the UK rejoin the EU before January 1, 2028?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: A quantum computing facility powered by nuclear energy becomes operational at any point between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The facility must be officially inaugurated and operational, with confirmation from both the operating company and a reputable news source.

Then, will the United Kingdom officially rejoin the European Union between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028? The rejoining must be confirmed by official announcements from both the UK government and the European Union.

not_P.title: Given a nuclear-powered quantum computing facility is operational before January 1, 2028, will the UK not rejoin the EU before January 1, 2028?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: A quantum computing facility powered by nuclear energy becomes operational at any point between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The facility must be officially inaugurated and operational, with confirmation from both the operating company and a reputable news source.

Then, will the United Kingdom not officially rejoin the European Union between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028? The rejoining must be confirmed by official announcements from both the UK government and the European Union.

para_P.title: If a nuclear-powered quantum computing facility is functioning prior to January 1, 2028, will the United Kingdom re-enter the EU before that date?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: A quantum computing facility that utilizes nuclear power becomes operational at any time from October 1, 2024, to January 1, 2028. The facility needs to be officially launched and in operation, with verification from both the managing company and a credible news outlet.

In that case, will the UK formally rejoin the European Union during the period from October 1, 2024, to January 1, 2028? This rejoining must be validated by official statements from both the UK government and the European Union.

question.title: Given both a nuclear-powered quantum computing facility becomes operational and the UK rejoins the EU before January 1, 2028, will Italy announce a new nuclear power plant by then?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both (1) a quantum computing facility powered by nuclear energy becomes operational and (2) the United Kingdom officially rejoins the European Union, both occurring between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The facility must be officially inaugurated and operational, with confirmation from both the operating company and a reputable news source. The rejoining must be confirmed by official announcements from both the UK government and the European Union.

Given this, will the Italian government officially announce the construction of a new nuclear power plant between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028? The announcement must be made by an official government agency and reported by reputable news sources.

not_P.title: Given both a nuclear-powered quantum computing facility does not become operational and the UK does not rejoin the EU before January 1, 2028, will Italy not announce a new nuclear power plant by then?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both (1) a quantum computing facility powered by nuclear energy does not become operational and (2) the United Kingdom does not officially rejoin the European Union, both occurring between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The facility must not be officially inaugurated and operational, with no confirmation from both the operating company and a reputable news source. The rejoining must not be confirmed by official announcements from both the UK government and the European Union.

Given this, will the Italian government not officially announce the construction of a new nuclear power plant between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028? The announcement must not be made by an official government agency and reported by reputable news sources.

para_P.title: If a nuclear-powered quantum computing plant is launched and the UK reenters the EU prior to January 1, 2028, will Italy reveal plans for a new nuclear power station by that date?
para_P.body:
Assume the following conditions hold: (1) a nuclear energy-driven quantum computing plant is launched and (2) the United Kingdom reenters the European Union, both happening between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The facility must be officially launched and functioning, with verification from both the operating entity and a credible news outlet. The UK’s reentry must be confirmed through official statements from both the UK government and the European Union.

Given these circumstances, will the Italian authorities make an official declaration regarding the development of a new nuclear power station between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028? The declaration must come from a government body and be covered by trustworthy news organizations.

question.title: Will all of the following occur before January 1, 2028: (1) A nuclear-powered quantum computing facility becomes operational, (2) The United Kingdom officially rejoins the European Union, and (3) Italy announces the construction of a new nuclear power plant?
question.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if all of the following occur: (1) A quantum computing facility powered by nuclear energy becomes operational at any point between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The facility must be officially inaugurated and operational, with confirmation from both the operating company and a reputable news source. (2) The United Kingdom officially rejoins the European Union between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The rejoining must be confirmed by official announcements from both the UK government and the European Union. (3) The Italian government officially announces the construction of a new nuclear power plant between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The announcement must be made by an official government agency and reported by reputable news sources.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur before January 1, 2028: (1) A nuclear-powered quantum computing facility becomes operational, (2) The United Kingdom officially rejoins the European Union, and (3) Italy announces the construction of a new nuclear power plant?
not_P.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if at least one of the following does not occur: (1) A quantum computing facility powered by nuclear energy becomes operational at any point between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The facility must be officially inaugurated and operational, with confirmation from both the operating company and a reputable news source. (2) The United Kingdom officially rejoins the European Union between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The rejoining must be confirmed by official announcements from both the UK government and the European Union. (3) The Italian government officially announces the construction of a new nuclear power plant between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The announcement must be made by an official government agency and reported by reputable news sources.

para_P.title: Will all of the following take place prior to January 1, 2028: (1) A quantum computing facility utilizing nuclear power becomes operational, (2) The United Kingdom formally reenters the European Union, and (3) Italy reveals plans for the construction of a new nuclear energy plant?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with 'Yes' if all of the following conditions are met: (1) A nuclear energy-powered quantum computing facility becomes operational at any time between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The facility must be officially inaugurated and functioning, with verification from both the operating company and a credible news outlet. (2) The United Kingdom formally reenters the European Union between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. This reentry must be confirmed by official announcements from both the UK government and the European Union. (3) The Italian government officially declares the initiation of a new nuclear power plant's construction between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. This declaration must come from an official government agency and be reported by trustworthy news organizations.

question.title: Will Australia announce the construction of a new nuclear power plant before January 1, 2028?
question.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if the government of Australia announces the construction of a new nuclear power plant at any point between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The announcement must be officially confirmed by the Australian government and reported by reputable news sources.

not_P.title: Will Australia not announce the construction of a new nuclear power plant before January 1, 2028?
not_P.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if the government of Australia does not announce the construction of a new nuclear power plant at any point between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The absence of an announcement must be officially confirmed by the Australian government and reported by reputable news sources.

para_P.title: Is it expected that Australia will declare the building of a new nuclear power facility prior to January 1, 2028?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be determined as 'Yes' if the Australian government makes a formal announcement regarding the establishment of a new nuclear power facility at any time from October 1, 2024, to January 1, 2028. The declaration must be officially acknowledged by the government of Australia and covered by credible news outlets.

question.title: Given Australia announces a new nuclear power plant, will any country ban a WHO-identified harmful chemical by 2028?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: The government of Australia announces the construction of a new nuclear power plant at any point between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The announcement must be officially confirmed by the Australian government and reported by reputable news sources. Then, is it true that between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, any country passes legislation banning the use of a specific chemical substance that has been identified as harmful by the World Health Organization (WHO)? The legislation must be officially enacted and published in the country's official legal records.

not_P.title: Given Australia announces a new nuclear power plant, will no country ban a WHO-identified harmful chemical by 2028?
not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: The government of Australia announces the construction of a new nuclear power plant at any point between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The announcement must be officially confirmed by the Australian government and reported by reputable news sources. Then, is it true that between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, no country passes legislation banning the use of a specific chemical substance that has been identified as harmful by the World Health Organization (WHO)? The legislation must be officially enacted and published in the country's official legal records.

para_P.title: If Australia reveals plans for a new nuclear facility, will any nation prohibit a WHO-recognized hazardous chemical by 2028?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds: The Australian government discloses the development of a new nuclear facility at some time between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. This announcement must be officially verified by the Australian authorities and covered by credible news outlets. Then, is it accurate to say that during the period from October 1, 2024, to January 1, 2028, any nation enacts laws that ban the utilization of a particular chemical substance deemed harmful by the World Health Organization (WHO)? The law must be formally enacted and documented in the country's official legal archives.

question.title: Given both events occur: Australia announces a new nuclear power plant and a country bans a WHO-identified harmful chemical before January 1, 2028, will NATO deploy nuclear weapons in a member country for the first time since 2024 before January 1, 2028?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, both of the following occur: (a) The government of Australia announces the construction of a new nuclear power plant, with the announcement officially confirmed by the Australian government and reported by reputable news sources. (b) Any country passes legislation banning the use of a specific chemical substance that has been identified as harmful by the World Health Organization (WHO), with the legislation officially enacted and published in the country's official legal records.

Then, will NATO deploy nuclear weapons in a member country for the first time since 2024 before January 1, 2028? This deployment must be officially confirmed by NATO through a public announcement or official documentation.

not_P.title: Given both events occur: Australia announces a new nuclear power plant and a country does not ban a WHO-identified harmful chemical before January 1, 2028, will NATO not deploy nuclear weapons in a member country for the first time since 2024 before January 1, 2028?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, both of the following occur: (a) The government of Australia announces the construction of a new nuclear power plant, with the announcement officially confirmed by the Australian government and reported by reputable news sources. (b) No country passes legislation banning the use of a specific chemical substance that has been identified as harmful by the World Health Organization (WHO), with the legislation officially enacted and published in the country's official legal records.

Then, will NATO not deploy nuclear weapons in a member country for the first time since 2024 before January 1, 2028? This deployment must be officially confirmed by NATO through a public announcement or official documentation.

para_P.title: If both events take place: Australia reveals plans for a new nuclear facility and a nation prohibits a WHO-recognized dangerous chemical prior to January 1, 2028, will NATO position nuclear arms in a member nation for the first time since 2024 before January 1, 2028?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following conditions are met: Between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, both of these events happen: (a) The Australian government unveils its intention to build a new nuclear power station, with the announcement officially verified by the Australian authorities and covered by credible news outlets. (b) Any nation enacts a law banning the use of a particular chemical that has been classified as harmful by the World Health Organization (WHO), with the law formally enacted and recorded in the nation’s official legal documents.

Then, will NATO position nuclear arms in a member nation for the first time since 2024 before January 1, 2028? This positioning must be officially acknowledged by NATO through a public declaration or formal documentation.

question.title: Will all of the following occur before January 1, 2028: (1) Australia announces the construction of a new nuclear power plant, (2) any country passes legislation banning a WHO-identified harmful chemical substance, and (3) NATO deploys nuclear weapons in a member country for the first time since 2024?
question.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if, between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, all of the following occur: (1) The government of Australia announces the construction of a new nuclear power plant, with the announcement officially confirmed by the Australian government and reported by reputable news sources. (2) Any country passes legislation banning the use of a specific chemical substance that has been identified as harmful by the World Health Organization (WHO), with the legislation officially enacted and published in the country's official legal records. (3) NATO deploys nuclear weapons in a member country for the first time since 2024, with the deployment officially confirmed by NATO through a public announcement or official documentation.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur before January 1, 2028: (1) Australia does not announce the construction of a new nuclear power plant, (2) no country passes legislation banning a WHO-identified harmful chemical substance, and (3) NATO does not deploy nuclear weapons in a member country for the first time since 2024?
not_P.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if, between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, not all of the following occur: (1) The government of Australia does not announce the construction of a new nuclear power plant, with the announcement not officially confirmed by the Australian government and not reported by reputable news sources. (2) No country passes legislation banning the use of a specific chemical substance that has been identified as harmful by the World Health Organization (WHO), with the legislation not officially enacted and not published in the country's official legal records. (3) NATO does not deploy nuclear weapons in a member country for the first time since 2024, with the deployment not officially confirmed by NATO through a public announcement or official documentation.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the following events will take place before January 1, 2028: (1) Australia makes a formal announcement regarding the establishment of a new nuclear power facility, (2) any nation enacts a law prohibiting a harmful chemical substance identified by the WHO, and (3) NATO positions nuclear arms in a member nation for the first time since 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed 'Yes' if, during the period from October 1, 2024, to January 1, 2028, all of the subsequent events transpire: (1) The Australian government officially declares the initiation of a new nuclear power plant, with the announcement verified by the Australian government and covered by credible news outlets. (2) Any nation enacts legislation that bans the usage of a specific chemical substance recognized as harmful by the World Health Organization (WHO), with the law officially implemented and recorded in the nation's legal documents. (3) NATO positions nuclear weapons in a member country for the first time since 2024, with the deployment officially acknowledged by NATO through a public statement or formal documentation.

question.title: Will OpenAI release a nuclear risk assessment tool before January 1, 2028?
question.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if OpenAI releases a tool specifically designed for assessing nuclear risks at any point between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The tool must be publicly available and officially announced by OpenAI.

not_P.title: Will OpenAI not release a nuclear risk assessment tool before January 1, 2028?
not_P.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if OpenAI does not release a tool specifically designed for assessing nuclear risks at any point between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The tool must not be publicly available and officially announced by OpenAI.

para_P.title: Is OpenAI going to introduce a tool for evaluating nuclear risks prior to January 1, 2028?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with 'Yes' if OpenAI unveils a tool explicitly intended for the assessment of nuclear risks at any time from October 1, 2024, to January 1, 2028. The tool needs to be publicly accessible and officially declared by OpenAI.

question.title: Given OpenAI releases a nuclear risk assessment tool, will Elon Musk announce a nuclear-powered spacecraft before January 1, 2028?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: OpenAI releases a tool specifically designed for assessing nuclear risks at any point between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The tool must be publicly available and officially announced by OpenAI.

Then, will Elon Musk officially announce the development of a nuclear-powered spacecraft before January 1, 2028? The announcement must be made through official channels and include specific plans for the spacecraft's development.

Then, will Elon Musk not officially announce the development of a nuclear-powered spacecraft before January 1, 2028? The announcement must not be made through official channels and must not include specific plans for the spacecraft's development.

Assuming the following holds true: OpenAI unveils a tool aimed at assessing nuclear dangers at any time from October 1, 2024, to January 1, 2028. This tool needs to be publicly accessible and officially declared by OpenAI.

question.title: Given both OpenAI releases a nuclear risk assessment tool and Elon Musk announces a nuclear-powered spacecraft, will the US pass a federal AI ethics law for energy management by 2028?

The law must be officially enacted and documented in US federal legal records.

para_P.title: If OpenAI introduces a tool for evaluating nuclear threats and Elon Musk reveals a nuclear-powered space vehicle, will the United States implement a national AI ethics law for energy management by the year 2028?
para_P.body: Assuming the following occurs: Between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, (a) OpenAI launches a tool aimed at assessing nuclear hazards, which is publicly accessible and formally announced by OpenAI, and (b) Elon Musk makes an official announcement regarding the creation of a nuclear-powered spacecraft through recognized channels, including detailed plans for its construction. para_P.title: Will all of the following take place prior to January 1, 2028: (1) OpenAI unveils a tool for assessing nuclear risks, (2) Elon Musk reveals a nuclear-powered spacecraft, and (3) the United States enacts a federal law governing the ethical application of AI in energy management?

question.title: Will California pass legislation banning the sale of gasoline-powered vehicles before January 1, 2028?
question.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if, between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, the state of California passes legislation that explicitly bans the sale of gasoline-powered vehicles. The legislation must be officially enacted and published in California's official legal records.

not_P.title: Will California not pass legislation banning the sale of gasoline-powered vehicles before January 1, 2028?

para_P.title: Is it possible that California will enact a law prohibiting the sale of gasoline-powered vehicles prior to January 1, 2028?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with 'Yes' if, during the period from October 1, 2024, to January 1, 2028, California enacts a law that clearly prohibits the sale of gasoline-powered vehicles. The law must be formally passed and recorded in California's official legal documentation.

question.title: Given California passes legislation banning the sale of gasoline-powered vehicles before January 1, 2028, will Sweden hold a national election before January 1, 2028?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: California passes legislation banning the sale of gasoline-powered vehicles between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The legislation must be officially enacted and published in California's official legal records.

Then, will Sweden hold a national election between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028? The election must be officially recognized and its results recorded by the Swedish Election Authority.

not_P.title: Given California passes legislation banning the sale of gasoline-powered vehicles before January 1, 2028, will Sweden not hold a national election before January 1, 2028?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: California passes legislation banning the sale of gasoline-powered vehicles between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The legislation must be officially enacted and published in California's official legal records.

Then, will Sweden not hold a national election between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028? The election must be officially recognized and its results recorded by the Swedish Election Authority.

para_P.title: If California enacts a law that prohibits the sale of gasoline-powered cars prior to January 1, 2028, will Sweden conduct a national election before January 1, 2028?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following is accurate: California enacts a law that bans the sale of gasoline-powered vehicles from October 1, 2024, up until January 1, 2028. This law must be formally established and documented in California's official legal records.

Consequently, will Sweden carry out a national election during the period from October 1, 2024, to January 1, 2028? The election must be officially acknowledged and its outcomes recorded by the Swedish Election Authority.

question.title: Given California bans gasoline vehicle sales and Sweden holds an election before January 1, 2028, will Australia regulate its energy sector by then?

The California legislation must be officially enacted and published in California's official legal records. The Swedish election must be officially recognized and its results recorded by the Swedish Election Authority. 

Then, will the Australian government implement new regulations specifically targeting the energy sector before January 1, 2028? The regulations must be implemented between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, officially signed into law, and documented in the Australian Government Gazette.

question.title: Given atmospheric CO2 levels exceed 450 ppm for any monthly average before 2028, will Spain's unemployment rate fall below 10% for any quarter before 2028?

para_P.title: If Mexico's GDP increases by at least 15% from its 2023 figure and India adds a minimum of 200 GW of renewable energy capacity by January 1, 2028, will NATO accept a new member nation prior to January 1, 2028?
para_P.body:
Assume the following conditions hold: (a) From October 1, 2024, to January 1, 2028, Mexico's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) rises by no less than 15% compared to its level in 2023, with GDP statistics obtained from the World Bank or International Monetary Fund (IMF); and (b) India achieves the installation of at least 200 GW of renewable energy capacity, as confirmed by the Ministry of New and Renewable Energy, at any time before January 1, 2028, with the installation being officially acknowledged and recorded by the Ministry of New and Renewable Energy.

Under these circumstances, will NATO welcome a new member nation between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028? The membership must be validated by official announcements from NATO and the new member nation must be listed on NATO's official website.

question.title: Will all of the following occur by January 1, 2028: (a) Mexico's GDP grows by at least 15% from its 2023 level, (b) India installs at least 200 GW of renewable energy capacity, and (c) NATO admits a new member state?
question.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if all of the following conditions are met: (a) Between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, Mexico's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) grows by at least 15% from its 2023 level, with the GDP data sourced from the World Bank or International Monetary Fund (IMF); (b) India installs at least 200 GW of renewable energy capacity, as reported by the Ministry of New and Renewable Energy, at any point before January 1, 2028, with the installation officially recognized and documented by the Ministry of New and Renewable Energy; and (c) NATO admits a new member state between October 1, 2024 and January 1, 2028, with the admission confirmed by official NATO announcements and the new member state listed on NATO's official website.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur by January 1, 2028: (a) Mexico's GDP grows by at least 15% from its 2023 level, (b) India installs at least 200 GW of renewable energy capacity, and (c) NATO admits a new member state?
not_P.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if not all of the following conditions are met: (a) Between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, Mexico's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) does not grow by at least 15% from its 2023 level, with the GDP data sourced from the World Bank or International Monetary Fund (IMF); (b) India does not install at least 200 GW of renewable energy capacity, as reported by the Ministry of New and Renewable Energy, at any point before January 1, 2028, with the installation not officially recognized and documented by the Ministry of New and Renewable Energy; and (c) NATO does not admit a new member state between October 1, 2024 and January 1, 2028, with the admission not confirmed by official NATO announcements and the new member state not listed on NATO's official website.

para_P.title: By January 1, 2028, will the following take place: (a) Mexico's GDP increases by a minimum of 15% compared to its level in 2023, (b) India adds at least 200 GW of renewable energy capacity, and (c) NATO welcomes a new member country?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved affirmatively if all of these conditions are satisfied: (a) From October 1, 2024, to January 1, 2028, Mexico's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) must rise by at least 15% from its 2023 figure, with GDP statistics obtained from the World Bank or International Monetary Fund (IMF); (b) India must install a minimum of 200 GW of renewable energy capacity, as stated by the Ministry of New and Renewable Energy, at any time before January 1, 2028, with the installation officially acknowledged and recorded by the Ministry of New and Renewable Energy; and (c) NATO must admit a new member country between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, with the admission verified by official NATO announcements and the new member country listed on NATO's official website.

question.title: Given a company associated with the Republican Party achieves a $100 billion market cap, will a new biotech method for nuclear waste be approved by 2028?

question.title: Will a major philosophical framework addressing climate change ethics gain formal endorsement by at least three national governments before January 1, 2028?
question.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if a major philosophical framework addressing climate change ethics gains formal endorsement by at least three national governments at any point between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. question.title: Given a major philosophical framework on climate change ethics is endorsed by three national governments, will Spain commission a new nuclear power plant by 2028?
question.body:

Then, will Spain commission a new nuclear power plant before January 1, 2028? This means a new nuclear power plant must be officially commissioned and begin commercial operation in Spain between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The commissioning must be confirmed by an official announcement from the relevant Spanish regulatory authority.

question.title: Conditional on both a major climate change ethics framework and a new nuclear power plant in Spain, will an international antibiotic resistance policy be adopted by 50 countries before 2028?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) A major philosophical framework addressing climate change ethics gains formal endorsement by at least three national governments between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The endorsement must be officially documented and publicly announced by the respective governments. (b) A new nuclear power plant is officially commissioned and begins commercial operation in Spain between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The commissioning must be confirmed by an official announcement from the relevant Spanish regulatory authority.

Then, will an international policy framework for the prevention and control of antibiotic-resistant bacteria be adopted by at least 50 countries before January 1, 2028? This requires the framework to be officially endorsed by an international organization such as the World Health Organization (WHO) and to include specific guidelines or regulations for antibiotic use and resistance management.

(2) An international policy framework for the prevention and control of antibiotic-resistant bacteria is adopted by fewer than 50 countries. The framework must not be officially endorsed by an international organization such as the World Health Organization (WHO) or must not include specific guidelines or regulations for antibiotic use and resistance management.

question.title: Given both a nuclear-powered robotic system is deployed for environmental monitoring and the US Senate has at least 55 Democratic members, will Virginia's average annual temperature increase by at least 1.5°C by January 1, 2028?

question.title: Will NASA and at least two other national space agencies sign a formal agreement to collaborate on a manned mission to Mars before January 1, 2028?
question.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if NASA and at least two other national space agencies sign a formal agreement to collaborate on a manned mission to Mars between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The agreement must be officially announced by NASA and the collaborating space agencies and must include specific commitments to joint mission planning, funding, or resource sharing.

not_P.title: Will NASA and fewer than two other national space agencies not sign a formal agreement to collaborate on a manned mission to Mars before January 1, 2028?
not_P.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if NASA and fewer than two other national space agencies do not sign a formal agreement to collaborate on a manned mission to Mars between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The agreement must not be officially announced by NASA and the collaborating space agencies and must not include specific commitments to joint mission planning, funding, or resource sharing.

para_P.title: Will there be a formal collaboration agreement between NASA and a minimum of two other national space agencies for a crewed mission to Mars prior to January 1, 2028?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with 'Yes' if NASA, along with at least two other national space agencies, formalizes an agreement to work together on a crewed mission to Mars during the period from October 1, 2024, to January 1, 2028. The agreement must be publicly announced by NASA and the partnering space agencies and should detail specific commitments related to joint mission planning, funding, or resource sharing.

question.title: Conditional on NASA and at least two other national space agencies signing a formal agreement to collaborate on a manned mission to Mars before January 1, 2028, will a candidate from the field of astronomy run for the US Senate before January 1, 2028?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: NASA and at least two other national space agencies sign a formal agreement to collaborate on a manned mission to Mars between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The agreement must be officially announced by NASA and the collaborating space agencies and must include specific commitments to joint mission planning, funding, or resource sharing.

Then, will a candidate with a professional background in astronomy officially run for a seat in the US Senate between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028? The candidacy must be officially registered and publicly announced, and the individual must have a verifiable professional background in astronomy.

not_P.title: Conditional on NASA and at least two other national space agencies signing a formal agreement to collaborate on a manned mission to Mars before January 1, 2028, will a candidate from the field of astronomy not run for the US Senate before January 1, 2028?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: NASA and at least two other national space agencies sign a formal agreement to collaborate on a manned mission to Mars between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The agreement must be officially announced by NASA and the collaborating space agencies and must include specific commitments to joint mission planning, funding, or resource sharing.

Then, will a candidate with a professional background in astronomy not officially run for a seat in the US Senate between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028? The candidacy must be officially registered and publicly announced, and the individual must have a verifiable professional background in astronomy.

para_P.title: If NASA and at least two other national space organizations enter into a formal pact to work together on a crewed mission to Mars prior to January 1, 2028, will an individual with a background in astronomy declare their intention to run for the US Senate before January 1, 2028?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following scenario holds: NASA and at least two additional national space organizations finalize a formal agreement to collaborate on a crewed mission to Mars sometime between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. This agreement must be publicly announced by NASA along with the collaborating agencies and should detail specific commitments regarding joint mission planning, funding, or sharing of resources.

In that case, will a candidate possessing a professional background in astronomy formally announce their candidacy for a position in the US Senate between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028? The candidacy must be officially registered and publicly disclosed, and the individual must have a credible professional background in the field of astronomy.

question.title: GIVEN both a NASA-led Mars mission agreement and a US Senate candidacy by an astronomer occur, will Russia and Ukraine sign a peace treaty by 2028?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both of the following occur between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028: (1) NASA and at least two other national space agencies sign a formal agreement to collaborate on a manned mission to Mars, with specific commitments to joint mission planning, funding, or resource sharing, officially announced by NASA and the collaborating space agencies. (2) An individual with a professional background in astronomy officially runs for a seat in the US Senate, with the candidacy officially registered and publicly announced, and the individual having a verifiable professional background in astronomy.

Then is it true that between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, Russia and Ukraine sign and ratify a comprehensive peace treaty that ends all ongoing military conflicts between the two nations, officially recognized by both governments, ratified according to their respective legal processes, and resulting in a complete cessation of hostilities?

not_P.title: GIVEN both a NASA-led Mars mission agreement and a US Senate candidacy by an astronomer do not occur, will Russia and Ukraine not sign a peace treaty by 2028?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Either of the following does not occur between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028: (1) NASA and at least two other national space agencies do not sign a formal agreement to collaborate on a manned mission to Mars, with specific commitments to joint mission planning, funding, or resource sharing, officially announced by NASA and the collaborating space agencies. (2) An individual with a professional background in astronomy does not officially run for a seat in the US Senate, with the candidacy not officially registered and publicly announced, and the individual not having a verifiable professional background in astronomy.

Then is it true that between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, Russia and Ukraine do not sign and ratify a comprehensive peace treaty that ends all ongoing military conflicts between the two nations, officially recognized by both governments, ratified according to their respective legal processes, and resulting in a complete cessation of hostilities?

para_P.title: IF both a NASA-led Mars exploration agreement and a Senate campaign by an astronomer take place, will Russia and Ukraine finalize a peace accord by 2028?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Both of these events happen between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028: (1) NASA, along with at least two other national space agencies, enters into a formal collaboration agreement for a manned mission to Mars, which includes clear commitments to joint mission planning, funding, or resource sharing, and is officially announced by NASA and the collaborating agencies. (2) A candidate with a professional background in astronomy officially announces their intention to run for a position in the US Senate, with the candidacy registered and made public, demonstrating a verifiable professional background in astronomy.

Then, can we assert that between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, Russia and Ukraine will sign and ratify a comprehensive peace treaty that concludes all current military conflicts between the two countries, officially acknowledged by both governments, ratified in accordance with their respective legal frameworks, and leading to a total cessation of hostilities?

not_P.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if at least one of the following does not occur between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028: (1) NASA and at least two other national space agencies sign a formal agreement to collaborate on a manned mission to Mars. The agreement must be officially announced by NASA and the collaborating space agencies and must include specific commitments to joint mission planning, funding, or resource sharing. The candidacy must be officially registered and publicly announced, and the individual must have a verifiable professional background in astronomy. (3) Russia and Ukraine sign and ratify a comprehensive peace treaty that ends all ongoing military conflicts between the two nations. The treaty must be officially recognized by both governments, ratified according to their respective legal processes, and result in a complete cessation of hostilities.

para_P.title: Will the following events take place before January 1, 2028: (1) A formal agreement is signed by NASA and at least two other national space agencies to work together on a manned mission to Mars, (2) a candidate with a background in astronomy campaigns for a US Senate position, and (3) a comprehensive peace treaty is signed and ratified by Russia and Ukraine, putting an end to all military conflicts between the two countries?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with 'Yes' if all of the following happen between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028: (1) A formal agreement is established between NASA and at least two other national space agencies for collaboration on a manned Mars mission. This agreement must be publicly announced by NASA and the other agencies, detailing specific commitments to joint planning, funding, or sharing resources. (2) A person with professional credentials in astronomy officially declares their intention to run for a seat in the US Senate. The candidacy must be registered and made public, and the individual must have a verifiable professional background in astronomy.
