The treaty must be officially acknowledged by both governments, ratified as per their legal requirements, and lead to a total halt of hostilities.

question.title: Will a film primarily produced in Virginia win an Academy Award for Best Picture by January 1, 2028?
question.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if a film primarily produced in Virginia wins the Academy Award for Best Picture at any Academy Awards ceremony held between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The win must be officially announced by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences.

not_P.title: Will a film primarily produced in Virginia not win an Academy Award for Best Picture by January 1, 2028?
not_P.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if a film primarily produced in Virginia does not win the Academy Award for Best Picture at any Academy Awards ceremony held between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The win must be officially announced by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences.

para_P.title: Is it possible for a movie mainly created in Virginia to receive the Academy Award for Best Picture by January 1, 2028?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be determined as 'Yes' if a movie mainly created in Virginia receives the Academy Award for Best Picture at any Academy Awards event occurring between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The victory must be formally declared by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences.

question.title: Given a Virginia-produced film wins Best Picture by 2028, will US unemployment drop below 3% before 2028?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: A film primarily produced in Virginia wins the Academy Award for Best Picture at any Academy Awards ceremony held between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The win must be officially announced by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences.

Then, is it true that the US Bureau of Labor Statistics will report an unemployment rate of less than 3% for any month between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028? The unemployment rate must be officially published on the BLS website.

not_P.title: Given a Virginia-produced film wins Best Picture by 2028, will US unemployment not drop below 3% before 2028?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: A film primarily produced in Virginia wins the Academy Award for Best Picture at any Academy Awards ceremony held between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The win must be officially announced by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences.

Then, is it true that the US Bureau of Labor Statistics will not report an unemployment rate of less than 3% for any month between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028? The unemployment rate must be officially published on the BLS website.

para_P.title: If a film made in Virginia secures the Best Picture award by 2028, will the unemployment rate in the US fall below 3% prior to 2028?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: A movie mainly produced in Virginia is awarded the Academy Award for Best Picture at any ceremony occurring between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The announcement of the win must come from the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences.

Then, is it the case that the US Bureau of Labor Statistics will disclose an unemployment rate lower than 3% for any month from October 1, 2024, to January 1, 2028? The unemployment figures must be officially available on the BLS website.

question.title: Given both a Virginia-produced film wins Best Picture and US unemployment drops below 3% before 2028, will US inflation exceed 10% annually by 2027?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Both (1) A film primarily produced in Virginia wins the Academy Award for Best Picture at any Academy Awards ceremony held between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, with the win officially announced by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences, and (2) The US Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) reports an unemployment rate of less than 3% for any month between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, with the rate officially published on the BLS website. Then, will the Bureau of Labor Statistics report an annual inflation rate in the United States exceeding 10% for any calendar year between 2024 and 2027, based on official BLS data releases?

not_P.title: Given both a Virginia-produced film does not win Best Picture and US unemployment does not drop below 3% before 2028, will US inflation not exceed 10% annually by 2027?
not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: Both (1) No film primarily produced in Virginia wins the Academy Award for Best Picture at any Academy Awards ceremony held between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, with the win officially announced by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences, and (2) The US Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) does not report an unemployment rate of less than 3% for any month between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, with the rate officially published on the BLS website. Then, will the Bureau of Labor Statistics not report an annual inflation rate in the United States exceeding 10% for any calendar year between 2024 and 2027, based on official BLS data releases?

para_P.title: If a film made in Virginia wins the Academy Award for Best Picture and the unemployment rate in the US falls below 3% prior to 2028, will the annual inflation rate in the US surpass 10% by 2027?
para_P.body: Assuming the following conditions are met: (1) A movie primarily created in Virginia secures the Best Picture award at any Academy Awards event occurring between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, with the victory officially declared by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences, and (2) The US Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) indicates an unemployment rate lower than 3% for any month from October 1, 2024, to January 1, 2028, with this information officially published on the BLS website. Then, will the Bureau of Labor Statistics announce that the annual inflation rate in the United States exceeds 10% for any calendar year from 2024 to 2027, according to official BLS data releases?

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) A film primarily produced in Virginia wins an Academy Award for Best Picture before January 1, 2028, (2) The US Bureau of Labor Statistics reports an unemployment rate of less than 3% for any month before January 1, 2028, and (3) The Bureau of Labor Statistics reports an annual inflation rate in the United States exceeding 10% for any year between 2024 and 2027?
question.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if all of the following conditions are met: (1) A film primarily produced in Virginia wins the Academy Award for Best Picture at any Academy Awards ceremony held between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, with the win officially announced by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences. (2) The US Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) reports an unemployment rate of less than 3% for any month between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, with the rate officially published on the BLS website. (3) The Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) reports an annual inflation rate in the United States exceeding 10% for any calendar year between 2024 and 2027, based on official BLS data releases.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (1) A film primarily produced in Virginia wins an Academy Award for Best Picture before January 1, 2028, (2) The US Bureau of Labor Statistics reports an unemployment rate of less than 3% for any month before January 1, 2028, and (3) The Bureau of Labor Statistics reports an annual inflation rate in the United States not exceeding 10% for any year between 2024 and 2027?
not_P.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if at least one of the following conditions is not met: (1) A film primarily produced in Virginia wins the Academy Award for Best Picture at any Academy Awards ceremony held between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, with the win officially announced by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences. (2) The US Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) reports an unemployment rate of less than 3% for any month between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, with the rate officially published on the BLS website. (3) The Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) reports an annual inflation rate in the United States not exceeding 10% for any calendar year between 2024 and 2027, based on official BLS data releases.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the following events to take place: (1) A movie mainly created in Virginia receives the Academy Award for Best Picture prior to January 1, 2028, (2) The US Bureau of Labor Statistics indicates an unemployment rate below 3% for any month before January 1, 2028, and (3) The Bureau of Labor Statistics reports an annual inflation rate in the United States that surpasses 10% for any year from 2024 to 2027?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed 'Yes' if all of these conditions are satisfied: (1) A film primarily created in Virginia is awarded the Academy Award for Best Picture at any ceremony occurring between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, with the victory officially declared by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences. (2) The US Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) shows an unemployment rate of under 3% for any month from October 1, 2024, to January 1, 2028, with the figure officially listed on the BLS website. (3) The Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) indicates an annual inflation rate in the United States exceeding 10% for any calendar year from 2024 to 2027, according to official BLS data releases.

question.title: Will a European Union member state deploy a nationwide quantum computing infrastructure by January 1, 2028?
question.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if a European Union member state deploys a nationwide quantum computing infrastructure between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The deployment must be officially announced by the government of the member state and must include quantum computing resources accessible for public or private use across the entire country.

not_P.title: Will a European Union member state not deploy a nationwide quantum computing infrastructure by January 1, 2028?
not_P.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if no European Union member state deploys a nationwide quantum computing infrastructure between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The deployment must not be officially announced by the government of the member state and must not include quantum computing resources accessible for public or private use across the entire country.

para_P.title: Is it possible for a member country of the European Union to establish a comprehensive quantum computing network by January 1, 2028?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be determined as 'Yes' if a member country of the European Union establishes a comprehensive quantum computing network between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The establishment must be officially declared by the government of the member country and must comprise quantum computing resources available for public or private utilization throughout the entire nation.

question.title: Conditional on a European Union member state deploying nationwide quantum computing by January 1, 2028, will Japan implement a national AI ethics policy before January 1, 2028?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: A European Union member state deploys a nationwide quantum computing infrastructure between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The deployment must be officially announced by the government of the member state and must include quantum computing resources accessible for public or private use across the entire country.

Then, will Japan implement a national AI ethics policy between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028? The policy must be officially announced by the Japanese government and must include specific guidelines or regulations related to the ethical use of AI.

not_P.title: Conditional on a European Union member state deploying nationwide quantum computing by January 1, 2028, will Japan not implement a national AI ethics policy before January 1, 2028?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: A European Union member state deploys a nationwide quantum computing infrastructure between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The deployment must be officially announced by the government of the member state and must include quantum computing resources accessible for public or private use across the entire country.

Then, will Japan not implement a national AI ethics policy between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028? The policy must be officially announced by the Japanese government and must include specific guidelines or regulations related to the ethical use of AI.

para_P.title: If a member state of the European Union establishes a comprehensive quantum computing system nationwide by January 1, 2028, will Japan introduce a national policy on AI ethics prior to January 1, 2028?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: A member state of the European Union sets up a nationwide quantum computing framework between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. This setup must be officially declared by the government of that member state and should provide quantum computing capabilities available for both public and private use throughout the nation.

In that case, will Japan roll out a national AI ethics policy between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028? This policy must be officially announced by the Japanese government and should encompass specific guidelines or regulations pertaining to the ethical application of AI.

question.title: Conditional on both a European Union member state deploying nationwide quantum computing infrastructure and Japan implementing a national AI ethics policy by 2028, will NATO members' stock market capitalization exceed 50 trillion USD?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: By January 1, 2028, (a) a European Union member state deploys a nationwide quantum computing infrastructure, officially announced by the government and accessible for public or private use, and (b) Japan implements a national AI ethics policy, officially announced with specific guidelines or regulations. Then, will the combined total market capitalization of all NATO member countries' stock markets exceed 50 trillion USD at any point between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, based on official stock market statistics from recognized financial institutions or market indexes?

not_P.title: Conditional on both a European Union member state not deploying nationwide quantum computing infrastructure and Japan not implementing a national AI ethics policy by 2028, will NATO members' stock market capitalization not exceed 50 trillion USD?
not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: By January 1, 2028, (a) a European Union member state does not deploy a nationwide quantum computing infrastructure, officially announced by the government and accessible for public or private use, and (b) Japan does not implement a national AI ethics policy, officially announced with specific guidelines or regulations. Then, will the combined total market capitalization of all NATO member countries' stock markets not exceed 50 trillion USD at any point between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, based on official stock market statistics from recognized financial institutions or market indexes?

para_P.title: Given that a European Union country establishes a comprehensive quantum computing framework and Japan enacts a national policy on AI ethics by the year 2028, will the total market value of NATO nations' stock exchanges surpass 50 trillion USD?
para_P.body: Assuming the following conditions hold: By January 1, 2028, (a) a member of the European Union has set up a nationwide quantum computing network, publicly declared by the government and available for both public and private sector use, and (b) Japan has introduced a national AI ethics framework, officially published with clear guidelines or regulations. In that case, will the overall market capitalization of stock exchanges in all NATO countries exceed 50 trillion USD at any time from October 1, 2024, to January 1, 2028, according to official statistics from trusted financial institutions or market indices?

question.title: Will all of the following occur by January 1, 2028: (1) Both of the following occur: (a) A European Union member state deploys a nationwide quantum computing infrastructure, and (b) Japan implements a national AI ethics policy, and (2) The total market capitalization of NATO member countries' stock markets exceeds 50 trillion USD?
question.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if all of the following conditions are met between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028: (1) Both of the following occur: (a) A European Union member state deploys a nationwide quantum computing infrastructure. The deployment must be officially announced by the government of the member state and must include quantum computing resources accessible for public or private use across the entire country. (b) Japan implements a national AI ethics policy. The policy must be officially announced by the Japanese government and must include specific guidelines or regulations related to the ethical use of AI. (2) The combined total market capitalization of all NATO member countries' stock markets exceeds 50 trillion USD at any point during the specified period. The data must be based on official stock market statistics from recognized financial institutions or market indexes.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur by January 1, 2028: (1) Both of the following occur: (a) A European Union member state does not deploy a nationwide quantum computing infrastructure, or (b) Japan does not implement a national AI ethics policy, or (2) The total market capitalization of NATO member countries' stock markets does not exceed 50 trillion USD?
not_P.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if at least one of the following conditions is not met between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028: (1) Not both of the following occur: (a) A European Union member state does not deploy a nationwide quantum computing infrastructure. The deployment must not be officially announced by the government of the member state or must not include quantum computing resources accessible for public or private use across the entire country. (b) Japan does not implement a national AI ethics policy. The policy must not be officially announced by the Japanese government or must not include specific guidelines or regulations related to the ethical use of AI. (2) The combined total market capitalization of all NATO member countries' stock markets does not exceed 50 trillion USD at any point during the specified period. question.title: Conditional on China reducing carbon emissions by 25% and South Korea implementing AI healthcare by 2028, will France restrict biotechnology research by 2028?
question.body:
This question explores the scenario where both of the following occur by January 1, 2028: (a) China achieves a 25% reduction in its carbon emissions from 2024 levels, verified by official Chinese government reports or reputable international environmental organizations; and (b) South Korea implements a nationwide AI-driven healthcare system, officially announced by the South Korean government and involving AI in diagnostics, treatment planning, or patient management across the country.

Given these conditions, will France implement a national policy restricting biotechnology research before January 1, 2028? The resolution for this question is 'Yes' if the French government officially implements a national policy that restricts biotechnology research, enacted into law and coming into effect between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028.

not_P.title: Conditional on China not reducing carbon emissions by 25% or South Korea not implementing AI healthcare by 2028, will France not restrict biotechnology research by 2028?
not_P.body:
This question explores the scenario where at least one of the following does not occur by January 1, 2028: (a) China does not achieve a 25% reduction in its carbon emissions from 2024 levels, verified by official Chinese government reports or reputable international environmental organizations; or (b) South Korea does not implement a nationwide AI-driven healthcare system, officially announced by the South Korean government and involving AI in diagnostics, treatment planning, or patient management across the country.

Given these conditions, will France not implement a national policy restricting biotechnology research before January 1, 2028? The resolution for this question is 'Yes' if the French government does not officially implement a national policy that restricts biotechnology research, enacted into law and coming into effect between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028.

para_P.title: If China cuts its carbon emissions by 25% and South Korea adopts AI in healthcare by 2028, will France impose limits on biotechnology research by that year?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the situation where both of the following take place by January 1, 2028: (a) China successfully reduces its carbon emissions by 25% from the levels recorded in 2024, as confirmed by official reports from the Chinese government or credible international environmental organizations; and (b) South Korea establishes a comprehensive AI-based healthcare system, formally announced by the South Korean government and incorporating AI in areas such as diagnostics, treatment planning, or patient management across the nation.

Under these circumstances, will France enact a national policy that restricts biotechnology research prior to January 1, 2028? The answer to this question is 'Yes' if the French government officially puts into place a national policy that imposes restrictions on biotechnology research, enacted into law and taking effect between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028.

question.title: Will all of the following occur by January 1, 2028: (a) China achieves a 25% reduction in its carbon emissions from 2024 levels, (b) South Korea implements a nationwide AI-driven healthcare system, and (c) France implements a national policy restricting biotechnology research?
question.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if all of the following conditions are met between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028: (a) China achieves a 25% reduction in its carbon emissions compared to its 2024 levels, verified by official Chinese government reports or reputable international environmental organizations; (b) South Korea implements a nationwide AI-driven healthcare system, officially announced by the South Korean government, involving the use of artificial intelligence in diagnostics, treatment planning, or patient management across the entire country; and (c) the French government officially implements a national policy that restricts biotechnology research, with the policy enacted into law and coming into effect within this period.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur by January 1, 2028: (a) China achieves a 25% reduction in its carbon emissions from 2024 levels, (b) South Korea implements a nationwide AI-driven healthcare system, and (c) France implements a national policy restricting biotechnology research?
not_P.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if not all of the following conditions are met between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028: (a) China achieves a 25% reduction in its carbon emissions compared to its 2024 levels, verified by official Chinese government reports or reputable international environmental organizations; (b) South Korea implements a nationwide AI-driven healthcare system, officially announced by the South Korean government, involving the use of artificial intelligence in diagnostics, treatment planning, or patient management across the entire country; and (c) the French government officially implements a national policy that restricts biotechnology research, with the policy enacted into law and coming into effect within this period.

para_P.title: By January 1, 2028, will the following take place: (a) a 25% decrease in China's carbon emissions from the levels of 2024, (b) the establishment of a countrywide AI-based healthcare system in South Korea, and (c) the enactment of a national law in France that limits biotechnology research?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered as 'Yes' if all of these criteria are satisfied between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028: (a) China reduces its carbon emissions by 25% compared to its 2024 figures, as confirmed by official reports from the Chinese government or credible international environmental organizations; (b) South Korea rolls out a nationwide AI-driven healthcare system, officially declared by the South Korean government, which incorporates artificial intelligence in diagnostics, treatment planning, or patient management throughout the nation; and (c) the French government formally enacts a national policy that restricts research in biotechnology, with the policy being legislated and taking effect during this timeframe.

question.title: Will the US Congress enact a federal law mandating a nationwide reduction in greenhouse gas emissions by at least 30% before January 1, 2028?
question.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if, between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, the US Congress enacts a federal law that mandates a nationwide reduction in greenhouse gas emissions by at least 30% compared to the levels recorded in 2023. The law must be officially enacted and documented in the federal legal records.

The law must be officially passed and recorded in the federal legal documentation.

question.title: Given the US Congress enacts a federal law for a 30% reduction in greenhouse gas emissions, will a UK soccer club announce a net-zero carbon partnership by 2028?

question.title: Given both US and UK climate actions, will Russia host the Winter Olympics by 2028?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both of the following occur before January 1, 2028: (a) The US Congress enacts a federal law mandating a nationwide reduction in greenhouse gas emissions by at least 30%, and (b) A UK-based soccer club announces a partnership to offset their carbon emissions to net-zero. 

Resolution criteria for the condition: 
(a) Between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, the US Congress enacts a federal law that mandates a nationwide reduction in greenhouse gas emissions by at least 30% compared to the levels recorded in 2023. The law must be officially enacted and documented in the federal legal records. 
(b) Between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, any UK-based soccer club announces an official partnership aimed at offsetting their carbon emissions to net-zero. The announcement must be made through official club channels and documented on their website.

Then, is the following true: Russia will host the Winter Olympics before January 1, 2028?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if, between October 1, 2024 and January 1, 2028, Russia is officially confirmed as the host for the Winter Olympics by the International Olympic Committee (IOC). The confirmation must be announced through official IOC channels and documented on their website.

not_P.title: Given both US and UK climate actions, will Russia not host the Winter Olympics by 2028?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both of the following occur before January 1, 2028: (a) The US Congress does not enact a federal law mandating a nationwide reduction in greenhouse gas emissions by at least 30%, or (b) A UK-based soccer club does not announce a partnership to offset their carbon emissions to net-zero. 

Resolution criteria for the condition: 
(a) Between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, the US Congress does not enact a federal law that mandates a nationwide reduction in greenhouse gas emissions by at least 30% compared to the levels recorded in 2023. The law must not be officially enacted and documented in the federal legal records. 
(b) Between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, no UK-based soccer club announces an official partnership aimed at offsetting their carbon emissions to net-zero. The announcement must not be made through official club channels and documented on their website.

Then, is the following true: Russia will not host the Winter Olympics before January 1, 2028?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if, between October 1, 2024 and January 1, 2028, Russia is not officially confirmed as the host for the Winter Olympics by the International Olympic Committee (IOC). The confirmation must not be announced through official IOC channels and documented on their website.

para_P.title: Considering the climate initiatives of both the US and the UK, will Russia serve as the host for the Winter Olympics by the year 2028?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following conditions are met: Both of these events take place prior to January 1, 2028: (a) The US Congress passes a federal statute requiring a nationwide decrease in greenhouse gas emissions by at least 30%, and (b) A soccer club based in the UK declares a partnership to achieve net-zero carbon emissions.

(a) Between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, the US Congress must pass a federal law that enforces a nationwide reduction in greenhouse gas emissions by at least 30% relative to the figures recorded in 2023. This law must be officially enacted and recorded in the federal legal documents. 
(b) Between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, any soccer club located in the UK must announce an official partnership aimed at achieving net-zero carbon emissions. This announcement must be made through the club's official channels and documented on their website.

Then, is it accurate to say that Russia will host the Winter Olympics before January 1, 2028?

Criteria for determining the outcome: This question will be answered with 'Yes' if, between October 1, 2024 and January 1, 2028, Russia is officially recognized as the host for the Winter Olympics by the International Olympic Committee (IOC). The confirmation must be communicated through official IOC channels and documented on their website.

para_P.title: Is it possible that all of the following will take place before January 1, 2028: (1) The US Congress passes a federal statute requiring a nationwide decrease in greenhouse gas emissions by at least 30%, (2) A soccer club based in the UK reveals a collaboration to achieve net-zero carbon emissions, and (3) Russia is officially designated as the host for the Winter Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with 'Yes' if all of the following happen between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028: (1) The US Congress passes a federal statute that requires a nationwide reduction in greenhouse gas emissions by at least 30% compared to the levels noted in 2023. question.title: Will Taiwan's GDP growth rate exceed 5% in any calendar year between 2024 and 2027?
question.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if Taiwan's GDP growth rate exceeds 5% in any calendar year between 2024 and 2027. para_P.title: In the event that Taiwan's GDP growth rate surpasses 5% and US inflation surpasses 10% at any point during the years 2024 to 2027, will Virginia achieve a successful orbital rocket launch prior to 2028?

question.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if the United States Congress passes a federal law specifically regulating the use of artificial intelligence in critical infrastructure (such as power grids, water supply systems, or transportation networks) between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. question.title: Given the US passes a federal AI law for critical infrastructure, will a new nuclear safety treaty be signed and ratified by 2028?

- China must not officially announce a new political initiative aimed at reducing carbon emissions by at least 30% from 2024 levels between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The initiative must not be formally documented and announced through official government channels and must not include specific targets and measures for achieving the reduction.
- Spain's annual GDP growth rate must not exceed 3% for at least one full calendar year between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, as reported by the IMF or the World Bank.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The US Congress must not pass a bill specifically aimed at reforming the Bureau of Labor Statistics between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The bill must not be signed into law and documented in official congressional records.

question.title: Conditional on both South Korea reducing emissions by 20% and Brazil reducing deforestation by 70% by 2028, will Russia reduce its emissions by 15% by 2028?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Both of the following occur before January 1, 2028: (a) South Korea's greenhouse gas emissions decrease by at least 20% from 2020 levels, and (b) Brazil reduces deforestation in the Amazon by at least 70% compared to 2020 levels. This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if both of the following conditions are met: (a) South Korea's greenhouse gas emissions decrease by at least 20% from 2020 levels at any point between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, based on official data from South Korea's Ministry of Environment or another reputable national or international organization; and (b) Brazil reduces deforestation in the Amazon by at least 70% compared to 2020 levels before January 1, 2028, verified by Brazil's National Institute for Space Research (INPE) or another reputable environmental monitoring organization. Then is the following true: Russia will reduce its annual greenhouse gas emissions by at least 15% compared to 2024 levels before January 1, 2028. This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if Russia's annual greenhouse gas emissions, as reported by a reputable environmental monitoring agency such as the Russian Federal State Statistics Service or the International Energy Agency, decrease by at least 15% compared to 2024 levels between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028.

para_P.title: If both South Korea cuts its emissions by 20% and Brazil decreases deforestation by 70% by 2028, will Russia cut its emissions by 15% by 2028?

question.title: Will China meet its target to peak carbon dioxide emissions before 2030 by January 1, 2028?

question.title: Given China meets its target to peak carbon dioxide emissions before 2030 by January 1, 2028, will any country pass legislation banning a WHO-identified harmful chemical by January 1, 2028?
question.body: Suppose China meets its target to peak carbon dioxide emissions before 2030 at any point between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. question.title: Given that China peaks its carbon emissions and a WHO-identified harmful chemical is banned, will a philosophical debate on nuclear technology be held internationally by 2028?
question.body:
Suppose the following occurs by January 1, 2028: (a) China peaks its carbon dioxide emissions before 2030, confirmed by official data from the Ministry of Ecology and Environment of the People's Republic of China or another authorized governmental body, and (b) any country passes legislation banning the use of a specific chemical substance identified as harmful by the World Health Organization (WHO), with the legislation officially enacted and published in the country's official legal records.

para_P.title: Is it certain that the following will take place by January 1, 2028: (a) China will reach its peak carbon dioxide emissions before 2030, (b) at least one nation will enact a law prohibiting a chemical deemed harmful by the WHO, and (c) there will be a philosophical discussion regarding nuclear technology and its associated risks at an international gathering?

question.title: Will the European Union's GDP growth rate exceed 4% for any calendar year between 2024 and 2028?
question.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if the GDP growth rate of the European Union, as reported by the World Bank or the International Monetary Fund (IMF), exceeds 4% for any calendar year between 2024 and 2028. The growth rate must be based on official annual GDP growth data.
